0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduces experimental preprocessing layers API\n(\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.experimental.preprocessing\u003c/code\u003e) to handle data preprocessing\noperations such as categorical feature encoding, text vectorization, data\nnormalization, and data discretization (binning). The newly added layers\nprovide a replacement for the legacy feature column API, and support\ncomposite tensor inputs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003cstrong\u003ecategorical data\u003c/strong\u003e processing layers:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eIntegerLookup\u003c/code\u003e \u0026amp; \u003ccode\u003eStringLookup\u003c/code\u003e: build an index of categorical feature\nvalues\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCategoryEncoding\u003c/code\u003e: turn integer-encoded categories into one-hot,\nmulti-hot, or tf-idf encoded representations\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCategoryCrossing\u003c/code\u003e: create new categorical features representing\nco-occurrences of previous categorical feature values\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eHashing\u003c/code\u003e: the hashing trick, for large-vocabulary categorical features\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDiscretization\u003c/code\u003e: turn continuous numerical features into categorical\nfeatures by binning their values\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved \u003cstrong\u003eimage preprocessing\u003c/strong\u003e layers: \u003ccode\u003eCenterCrop\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRescaling\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved \u003cstrong\u003eimage augmentation\u003c/strong\u003e layers: \u003ccode\u003eRandomCrop\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRandomFlip\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eRandomTranslation\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRandomRotation\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRandomHeight\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRandomWidth\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eRandomZoom\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRandomContrast\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTextVectorization\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e layer, which handles string tokenization,\nn-gram generation, and token encoding\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eTextVectorization\u003c/code\u003e layer now accounts for the mask_token as part of\nthe vocabulary size when output_mode='int'. This means that, if you have\na max_tokens value of 5000, your output will have 5000 unique values\n(not 5001 as before).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChange the return value of \u003ccode\u003eTextVectorization.get_vocabulary()\u003c/code\u003e from\n\u003ccode\u003ebyte\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003estring\u003c/code\u003e. Users who previously were calling 'decode' on the\noutput of this method should no longer need to do so.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduce new Keras dataset generation utilities :\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/preprocessing/image_dataset_from_directory\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eimage_dataset_from_directory\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\nis a utility based on \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e, meant to replace the legacy\n\u003ccode\u003eImageDataGenerator\u003c/code\u003e. It takes you from a structured directory of images\nto a labeled dataset, in one function call. Note that it doesn't perform\nimage data augmentation (which is meant to be done using preprocessing\nlayers).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/preprocessing/text_dataset_from_directory\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etext_dataset_from_directory\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\ntakes you from a structured directory of text files to a labeled\ndataset, in one function call.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/preprocessing/timeseries_dataset_from_array\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etimeseries_dataset_from_array\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\nis a \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e-based replacement of the legacy\n\u003ccode\u003eTimeseriesGenerator\u003c/code\u003e. It takes you from an array of timeseries data to\na dataset of shifting windows with their targets.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.3/api_docs/python/tf/keras/Model?hl=en#compile\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eexperimental_steps_per_execution\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\narg to \u003ccode\u003emodel.compile\u003c/code\u003e to indicate the number of batches to run per\n\u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e call. This can speed up Keras Models on TPUs up to 3x.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtends \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.Lambda\u003c/code\u003e layers to support multi-argument lambdas,\nand keyword arguments when calling the layer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFunctional models now get constructed if \u003cem\u003eany\u003c/em\u003e tensor in a layer call's\narguments/keyword arguments comes from a keras input. Previously the\nfunctional api would only work if all of the elements in the first argument\nto the layer came from a keras input.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eClean up \u003ccode\u003eBatchNormalization\u003c/code\u003e layer's \u003ccode\u003etrainable\u003c/code\u003e property to act like\nstandard python state when it's used inside \u003ccode\u003etf.functions\u003c/code\u003e (frozen at\ntracing time), instead of acting like a pseudo-variable whose updates \u003cem\u003ekind\nof sometimes\u003c/em\u003e get reflected in already-traced \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e traces.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd the \u003ccode\u003eConv1DTranspose\u003c/code\u003e layer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRefine the semantics of \u003ccode\u003eSensitivitySpecificityBase\u003c/code\u003e derived metrics. See\nthe updated API docstrings for\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.3/api_docs/python/tf/keras/metrics/SensitivityAtSpecificity\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.metrics.SensitivityAtSpecificity\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\nand\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.3/api_docs/python/tf/keras/metrics/SpecificityAtSensitivity\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.metrics.SpecificityAtSensitivty\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-tflite-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#tflite-1\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e:\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConverter\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRestored \u003ccode\u003einference_input_type\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003einference_output_type\u003c/code\u003e flags in TF\n2.x TFLiteConverter (backward compatible with TF 1.x) to support integer\n(tf.int8, tf.uint8) input and output types in post training full integer\nquantized models.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for converting and resizing models with dynamic\n(placeholder) dimensions. Previously, there was only limited support for\ndynamic batch size, and even that did not guarantee that the model could\nbe properly resized at runtime.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnabled experimental support for a new quantization mode with 16-bit\nactivations and 8-bit weights. See\n\u003ccode\u003elite.OpsSet.EXPERIMENTAL_TFLITE_BUILTINS_ACTIVATIONS_INT16_WEIGHTS_INT8\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCPU\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix an issue w/ dynamic weights and \u003ccode\u003eConv2D\u003c/code\u003e on x86.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a runtime Android flag for enabling \u003ccode\u003eXNNPACK\u003c/code\u003e for optimized CPU\nperformance.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a runtime iOS flag for enabling \u003ccode\u003eXNNPACK\u003c/code\u003e for optimized CPU\nperformance.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a compiler flag to enable building a TFLite library that applies\n\u003ccode\u003eXNNPACK\u003c/code\u003e delegate automatically when the model has a \u003ccode\u003efp32\u003c/code\u003e operation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGPU\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow GPU acceleration starting with internal graph nodes\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental support for quantized models with the Android GPU delegate\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd GPU delegate whitelist.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRename GPU whitelist -\u0026gt; compatibility (list).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove GPU compatibility list entries from crash reports.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNNAPI\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSet default value for\n\u003ccode\u003eStatefulNnApiDelegate::Options::max_number_delegated_partitions\u003c/code\u003e to 3.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd capability to disable \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e CPU and check \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e Errno.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix crashes when using \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e with target accelerator specified with\nmodel containing Conv2d or FullyConnected or LSTM nodes with quantized\nweights.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003eANEURALNETWORKS_BAD_DATA\u003c/code\u003e execution failures with\n\u003ccode\u003esum\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003emax\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003emin\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003ereduce\u003c/code\u003e operations with \u003ccode\u003escalar\u003c/code\u003e inputs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHexagon\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTFLite Hexagon Delegate out of experimental.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental \u003ccode\u003eint8\u003c/code\u003e support for most hexagon ops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental per-channel quant support for \u003ccode\u003econv\u003c/code\u003e in Hexagon delegate.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport dynamic batch size in C++ API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCoreML\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOpensource CoreML delegate\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMisc\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable building Android TFLite targets on Windows\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for \u003ccode\u003eBatchMatMul\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for \u003ccode\u003ehalf_pixel_centers\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eBroadcastDiv\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRename \u003ccode\u003ekTfLiteActRelu1\u003c/code\u003e to href=\"https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/d/msg/announce/gVwS5RC8mds/dCt1ka2XAAAJ\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003epreviously announced\u003c/a\u003e\nas following\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0373/#update\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ePython 2's EOL on January 1, 2020\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eCoinciding with this change, new releases of\n\u003ca href=\"https://hub.docker.com/r/tensorflow/tensorflow/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTensorFlow's Docker images\u003c/a\u003e\nprovide Python 3 exclusively. Because all images now use Python 3, Docker tags\ncontaining \u003ccode\u003e-py3\u003c/code\u003e will no longer be provided and existing \u003ccode\u003e-py3\u003c/code\u003e tags like\n\u003ccode\u003elatest-py3\u003c/code\u003e will not be updated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-major-features-and-improvements-18\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#major-features-and-improvements-18\"\u003eMajor Features and Improvements\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eReplaced the scalar type for string tensors from \u003ccode\u003estd::string\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow::tstring\u003c/code\u003e which is now ABI stable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA new Profiler for TF 2 for CPU/GPU/TPU. It offers both device and host\nperformance analysis, including input pipeline and TF Ops. Optimization\nadvisory is provided whenever possible. Please see\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/tensorboard/tensorboard_profiling_keras\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ethis tutorial\u003c/a\u003e\nand \u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/profiler\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eguide\u003c/a\u003e for usage guidelines.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eExport C++ functions to Python using \u003ccode\u003epybind11\u003c/code\u003e as opposed to \u003ccode\u003eSWIG\u003c/code\u003e as a\npart of our\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/community/blob/master/rfcs/20190208-pybind11.md\"\u003edeprecation of swig efforts\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport added for global sync \u003ccode\u003eBatchNormalization\u003c/code\u003e by using the newly\nadded \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.experimental.SyncBatchNormalization\u003c/code\u003e layer. This\nlayer will sync \u003ccode\u003eBatchNormalization\u003c/code\u003e statistics every step across all\nreplicas taking part in sync training.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance improvements for GPU multi-worker distributed training using\n\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.experimental.MultiWorkerMirroredStrategy\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate NVIDIA \u003ccode\u003eNCCL\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003e2.5.7-1\u003c/code\u003e for better performance and performance\ntuning. Please see\n\u003ca href=\"https://docs.nvidia.com/deeplearning/sdk/nccl-developer-guide/docs/env.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003enccl developer guide\u003c/a\u003e\nfor more information on this.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport gradient \u003ccode\u003eallreduce\u003c/code\u003e in \u003ccode\u003efloat16\u003c/code\u003e. See this\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/official/modeling/grad_utils.py\"\u003eexample\u003c/a\u003e\nusage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental support of\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/distribute/experimental/CollectiveHints\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eall reduce gradient packing\u003c/a\u003e\nto allow overlapping gradient aggregation with backward path\ncomputation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecated \u003ccode\u003eexperimental_run_v2\u003c/code\u003e method for distribution strategies and\nrenamed the method \u003ccode\u003erun\u003c/code\u003e as it is no longer experimental.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd CompositeTensor support for DistributedIterators. This should help\nprevent unnecessary function retracing and memory leaks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eModel.fit\u003c/code\u003e major improvements:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou can now use custom training logic with \u003ccode\u003eModel.fit\u003c/code\u003e by overriding\n\u003ccode\u003eModel.train_step\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEasily write state-of-the-art training loops without worrying about\nall of the features \u003ccode\u003eModel.fit\u003c/code\u003e handles for you (distribution\nstrategies, callbacks, data formats, looping logic, etc)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSee the default\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/1381fc8e15e22402417b98e3881dfd409998daea/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/training.py#L540\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eModel.train_step\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\nfor an example of what this function should look like. Same applies\nfor validation and inference via \u003ccode\u003eModel.test_step\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eModel.predict_step\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSavedModel uses its own \u003ccode\u003eModel._saved_model_inputs_spec\u003c/code\u003e attr now\ninstead of relying on \u003ccode\u003eModel.inputs\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eModel.input_names\u003c/code\u003e, which\nare no longer set for subclass Models. This attr is set in eager,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e, and graph modes. This gets rid of the need for users\nto manually call \u003ccode\u003eModel._set_inputs\u003c/code\u003e when using Custom Training\nLoops(CTLs).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDynamic shapes are supported for generators by calling the Model on\nthe first batch we \"peek\" from the generator. This used to happen\nimplicitly in \u003ccode\u003eModel._standardize_user_data\u003c/code\u003e. Long-term, a solution\nwhere the \u003ccode\u003eDataAdapter\u003c/code\u003e doesn't need to call the Model is probably\npreferable.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe SavedModel format now supports all Keras built-in layers (including\nmetrics, preprocessing layers, and stateful RNN layers)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate Keras batch normalization layer to use the running mean and\naverage computation in the \u003ccode\u003efused_batch_norm\u003c/code\u003e. You should see\nsignificant performance improvements when using \u003ccode\u003efused_batch_norm\u003c/code\u003e in\nEager mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable TFLite experimental new converter by default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eXLA\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eXLA now builds and works on windows. All prebuilt packages come with XLA\navailable.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eXLA can be\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/xla#explicit_compilation_with_tffunction\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eenabled for a \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\nwith “compile or throw exception” semantics on CPU and GPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-17\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#breaking-changes-17\"\u003eBreaking Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.applications\u003c/code\u003e the name of the \"top\" layer has been\nstandardized to \"predictions\". This is only a problem if your code\nrelies on the exact name of the layer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHuber loss function has been updated to be consistent with other Keras\nlosses. It now computes mean over the last axis of per-sample losses\nbefore applying the reduction function.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutoGraph no longer converts functions passed to \u003ccode\u003etf.py_function\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.py_func\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.numpy_function\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecating \u003ccode\u003eXLA_CPU\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eXLA_GPU\u003c/code\u003e devices with this release.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIncreasing the minimum bazel version to build TF to 2.0.0 to use Bazel's\n\u003ccode\u003ecc_experimental_shared_library\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras compile/fit behavior for functional and subclassed models have been\nunified. Model properties such as \u003ccode\u003emetrics\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003emetrics_names\u003c/code\u003e will now be\navailable only after \u003cstrong\u003etraining/evaluating the model on actual data\u003c/strong\u003e for\nfunctional models. \u003ccode\u003emetrics\u003c/code\u003e will \u003cstrong\u003enow include\u003c/strong\u003e model \u003ccode\u003eloss\u003c/code\u003e and output\nlosses.\u003ccode\u003eloss_functions\u003c/code\u003e property has been removed from the model. This was\nan undocumented property that was accidentally public and has now been\nremoved.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-known-caveats-8\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#known-caveats-8\"\u003eKnown Caveats\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved \u003ccode\u003eautotune_algorithm\u003c/code\u003e from experimental optimization options.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTF Core:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.constant\u003c/code\u003e always creates CPU tensors irrespective of the current\ndevice context.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEager \u003ccode\u003eTensorHandles\u003c/code\u003e maintain a list of mirrors for any copies to local\nor remote devices. This avoids any redundant copies due to op execution.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFor \u003ccode\u003etf.Tensor\u003c/code\u003e \u0026amp; \u003ccode\u003etf.Variable\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e.experimental_ref()\u003c/code\u003e is no longer\nexperimental and is available as simply \u003ccode\u003e.ref()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003epfor/vectorized_map\u003c/code\u003e: Added support for vectorizing 56 more ops.\nVectorizing \u003ccode\u003etf.cond\u003c/code\u003e is also supported now.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSet as much partial shape as we can infer statically within the gradient\nimpl of the gather op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGradient of \u003ccode\u003etf.while_loop\u003c/code\u003e emits \u003ccode\u003eStatelessWhile\u003c/code\u003e op if \u003ccode\u003econd\u003c/code\u003e and body\nfunctions are stateless. This allows multiple gradients while ops to run\nin parallel under distribution strategy.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSpeed up \u003ccode\u003eGradientTape\u003c/code\u003e in eager mode by auto-generating list of op\ninputs/outputs which are unused and hence not cached for gradient\nfunctions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport \u003ccode\u003eback_prop=False\u003c/code\u003e in \u003ccode\u003ewhile_v2\u003c/code\u003e but mark it as deprecated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove error message when attempting to use \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e in data-dependent\ncontrol flow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensor.numpy()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate \u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensor.__getitem__\u003c/code\u003e to preserve uniform dimensions \u0026amp; allow\nindexing into uniform dimensions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate \u003ccode\u003etf.expand_dims\u003c/code\u003e to always insert the new dimension as a\nnon-ragged dimension.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate \u003ccode\u003etf.embedding_lookup\u003c/code\u003e to use \u003ccode\u003epartition_strategy\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003emax_norm\u003c/code\u003e\nwhen \u003ccode\u003eids\u003c/code\u003e is ragged.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow \u003ccode\u003ebatch_dims==rank(indices)\u003c/code\u003e in \u003ccode\u003etf.gather\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for bfloat16 in \u003ccode\u003etf.print\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport \u003ccode\u003eembedding_column\u003c/code\u003e with variable-length input features for\n\u003ccode\u003eMultiWorkerMirroredStrategy\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eexperimental_aggregate_gradients\u003c/code\u003e argument to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.optimizer.Optimizer.apply_gradients\u003c/code\u003e. This allows custom\ngradient aggregation and processing aggregated gradients in custom\ntraining loop.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow \u003ccode\u003epathlib.Path\u003c/code\u003e paths for loading models via Keras API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e/AutoGraph:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutoGraph is now available in \u003ccode\u003eReplicaContext.merge_call\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eStrategy.extended.update\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eStrategy.extended.update_non_slot\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental support for shape invariants has been enabled in\n\u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e. See the API docs for\n\u003ccode\u003etf.autograph.experimental.set_loop_options\u003c/code\u003e for additional info.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutoGraph error messages now exclude frames corresponding to APIs\ninternal to AutoGraph.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove shape inference for \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e input arguments to unlock more\nGrappler optimizations in TensorFlow 2.x.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove automatic control dependency management of resources by allowing\nresource reads to occur in parallel and synchronizing only on writes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix execution order of multiple stateful calls to \u003ccode\u003eexperimental_run_v2\u003c/code\u003e\nin \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou can now iterate over \u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensors\u003c/code\u003e using a for loop inside\n\u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMigrated the \u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e C inference API out of experimental into lite/c.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd an option to disallow \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e CPU / partial acceleration on Android\n10\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTFLite Android AARs now include the C headers and APIs are required to\nuse TFLite from native code.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRefactors the delegate and delegate kernel sources to allow usage in the\nlinter.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLimit delegated ops to actually supported ones if a device name is\nspecified or \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e CPU Fallback is disabled.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTFLite now supports \u003ccode\u003etf.math.reciprocal1\u003c/code\u003e op by lowering to \u003ccode\u003etf.div op\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTFLite's unpack op now supports boolean tensor inputs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMicrocontroller and embedded code moved from experimental to main\nTensorFlow Lite folder\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCheck for large TFLite tensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix GPU delegate crash with C++17.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd 5D support to TFLite \u003ccode\u003estrided_slice\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix error in delegation of \u003ccode\u003eDEPTH_TO_SPACE\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e causing op not to\nbe accelerated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix segmentation fault when running a model with LSTM nodes using\n\u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e Delegate\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e delegate failure when an operand for Maximum/Minimum\noperation is a scalar.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e delegate failure when Axis input for reduce operation is a\nscalar.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose option to limit the number of partitions that will be delegated\nto \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf a target accelerator is specified, use its feature level to determine\noperations to delegate instead of SDK version.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.random\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVarious random number generation improvements:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a fast path for default \u003ccode\u003erandom_uniform\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003erandom_seed\u003c/code\u003e documentation improvement.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eRandomBinomial\u003c/code\u003e broadcasts and appends the sample shape to the left\nrather than the right.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.random.stateless_binomial\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.random.stateless_gamma\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.random.stateless_poisson\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.random.stateless_uniform\u003c/code\u003e now supports unbounded sampling of \u003ccode\u003eint\u003c/code\u003e\ntypes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMath and Linear Algebra:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.linalg.LinearOperatorTridiag\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eLinearOperatorBlockLowerTriangular\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd broadcasting support to\ntf.linalg.triangular_solve\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/26204\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/26204/hovercard\"\u003e#26204\u003c/a\u003e,\ntf.math.invert_permutation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.math.sobol_sample\u003c/code\u003e op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.math.xlog1py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.math.special.{dawsn,expi,fresnel_cos,fresnel_sin,spence}\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a Modified Discrete Cosine Transform (MDCT) and its inverse to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.signal\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTPU Enhancements:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRefactor \u003ccode\u003eTpuClusterResolver\u003c/code\u003e to move shared logic to a separate pip\npackage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport configuring TPU software version from cloud tpu client.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllowed TPU embedding weight decay factor to be multiplied by learning\nrate.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eXLA Support:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd standalone XLA AOT runtime target + relevant .cc sources to pip\npackage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd check for memory alignment to MemoryAllocation::MemoryAllocation()\non 32-bit ARM. This ensures a deterministic early exit instead of a hard\nto debug bus error later.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003esaved_model_cli aot_compile_cpu\u003c/code\u003e allows you to compile saved models to\nXLA header+object files and include them in your C++ programs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable \u003ccode\u003eIgamma\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eIgammac\u003c/code\u003e for XLA.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeterministic Op Functionality:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eXLA reduction emitter is deterministic when the environment variable\n\u003ccode\u003eTF_DETERMINISTIC_OPS\u003c/code\u003e is set to \"true\" or \"1\". This extends\ndeterministic \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.bias_add\u003c/code\u003e back-prop functionality (and therefore\nalso deterministic back-prop of bias-addition in Keras layers) to\ninclude when XLA JIT compilation is enabled.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix problem, when running on a CUDA GPU and when either environment\nvariable \u003ccode\u003eTF_DETERMINISTIC_OPS\u003c/code\u003e or environment variable\n\u003ccode\u003eTF_CUDNN_DETERMINISTIC\u003c/code\u003e is set to \"true\" or \"1\", in which some layer\nconfigurations led to an exception with the message \"No algorithm\nworked!\"\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTracing and Debugging:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd source, destination name to \u003ccode\u003e_send\u003c/code\u003e traceme to allow easier\ndebugging.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd traceme event to \u003ccode\u003efastpathexecute\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix an issue with AUC.reset_states for multi-label AUC\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/35852\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/35852/hovercard\"\u003e#35852\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix the TF upgrade script to not delete files when there is a parsing\nerror and the output mode is \u003ccode\u003ein-place\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove \u003ccode\u003etensorflow/core:framework/*_pyclif\u003c/code\u003e rules to\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow/core/framework:*_pyclif\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensorFlow 2.1 will be the last TF release supporting Python 2. Python 2 support\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0373/#update\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eofficially ends an January 1, 2020\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003ca href=\"https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/d/msg/announce/gVwS5RC8mds/dCt1ka2XAAAJ\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAs announced earlier\u003c/a\u003e,\nTensorFlow will also stop supporting Python 2 starting January 1, 2020, and no\nmore releases are expected in 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-major-features-and-improvements-19\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#major-features-and-improvements-19\"\u003eMajor Features and Improvements\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003etensorflow\u003c/code\u003e pip package now includes GPU support by default (same as\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow-gpu\u003c/code\u003e) for both Linux and Windows. This runs on machines with and\nwithout NVIDIA GPUs. \u003ccode\u003etensorflow-gpu\u003c/code\u003e is still available, and CPU-only\npackages can be downloaded at \u003ccode\u003etensorflow-cpu\u003c/code\u003e for users who are concerned\nabout package size.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWindows users:\u003c/strong\u003e Officially-released \u003ccode\u003etensorflow\u003c/code\u003e Pip packages are now\nbuilt with Visual Studio 2019 version 16.4 in order to take advantage of the\nnew \u003ccode\u003e/d2ReducedOptimizeHugeFunctions\u003c/code\u003e compiler flag. To use these new\npackages, you must install \"Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual\nStudio 2015, 2017 and 2019\", available from Microsoft's website\n\u003ca href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/help/2977003/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis does not change the minimum required version for building\nTensorFlow from source on Windows, but builds enabling\n\u003ccode\u003eEIGEN_STRONG_INLINE\u003c/code\u003e can take over 48 hours to compile without this\nflag. Refer to \u003ccode\u003econfigure.py\u003c/code\u003e for more information about\n\u003ccode\u003eEIGEN_STRONG_INLINE\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e/d2ReducedOptimizeHugeFunctions\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf either of the required DLLs, \u003ccode\u003emsvcp140.dll\u003c/code\u003e (old) or \u003ccode\u003emsvcp140_1.dll\u003c/code\u003e\n(new), are missing on your machine, \u003ccode\u003eimport tensorflow\u003c/code\u003e will print a\nwarning message.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003etensorflow\u003c/code\u003e pip package is built with CUDA 10.1 and cuDNN 7.6.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental support for mixed precision is available on GPUs and Cloud\nTPUs. See\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/keras/mixed_precision\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eusage guide\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduced the \u003ccode\u003eTextVectorization\u003c/code\u003e layer, which takes as input raw\nstrings and takes care of text standardization, tokenization, n-gram\ngeneration, and vocabulary indexing. See this\n\u003ca href=\"https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1RvCnR7h0_l4Ekn5vINWToI9TNJdpUZB3\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eend-to-end text classification example\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras \u003ccode\u003e.compile\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003e.fit\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003e.evaluate\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e.predict\u003c/code\u003e are allowed to be\noutside of the DistributionStrategy scope, as long as the model was\nconstructed inside of a scope.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental support for Keras \u003ccode\u003e.compile\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e.fit\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e.evaluate\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003e.predict\u003c/code\u003e is available for Cloud TPUs, Cloud TPU, for all types of\nKeras models (sequential, functional and subclassing models).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutomatic outside compilation is now enabled for Cloud TPUs. This allows\n\u003ccode\u003etf.summary\u003c/code\u003e to be used more conveniently with Cloud TPUs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDynamic batch sizes with DistributionStrategy and Keras are supported on\nCloud TPUs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport for \u003ccode\u003e.fit\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e.evaluate\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e.predict\u003c/code\u003e on TPU using numpy data, in\naddition to \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras reference implementations for many popular models are available in\nthe TensorFlow\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official\"\u003eModel Garden\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanges rebatching for \u003ccode\u003etf.data datasets\u003c/code\u003e + DistributionStrategy for\nbetter performance. Note that the dataset also behaves slightly\ndifferently, in that the rebatched dataset cardinality will always be a\nmultiple of the number of replicas.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e now supports automatic data distribution and sharding\nin distributed environments, including on TPU pods.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDistribution policies for \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e can now be tuned with 1.\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.AutoShardPolicy(OFF, AUTO, FILE, DATA)\u003c/code\u003e 2.\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.ExternalStatePolicy(WARN, IGNORE, FAIL)\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.debugging\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.debugging.enable_check_numerics()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.debugging.disable_check_numerics()\u003c/code\u003e to help debugging the root\ncauses of issues involving infinities and \u003ccode\u003eNaN\u003c/code\u003es.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCustom training loop support on TPUs and TPU pods is available through\n\u003ccode\u003estrategy.experimental_distribute_dataset\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003estrategy.experimental_distribute_datasets_from_function\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003estrategy.experimental_run_v2\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003estrategy.reduce\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport for a global distribution strategy through\n\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.experimental_set_strategy(),\u003c/code\u003e in addition to\n\u003ccode\u003estrategy.scope()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTensorRT\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://developer.nvidia.com/tensorrt#tensorrt-whats-new\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTensorRT 6.0\u003c/a\u003e\nis now supported and enabled by default. This adds support for more\nTensorFlow ops including Conv3D, Conv3DBackpropInputV2, AvgPool3D,\nMaxPool3D, ResizeBilinear, and ResizeNearestNeighbor. In addition, the\nTensorFlow-TensorRT python conversion API is exported as\n\u003ccode\u003etf.experimental.tensorrt.Converter\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnvironment variable \u003ccode\u003eTF_DETERMINISTIC_OPS\u003c/code\u003e has been added. When set to\n\"true\" or \"1\", this environment variable makes \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.bias_add\u003c/code\u003e operate\ndeterministically (i.e. reproducibly), but currently only when XLA JIT\ncompilation is \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e enabled. Setting \u003ccode\u003eTF_DETERMINISTIC_OPS\u003c/code\u003e to \"true\" or\n\"1\" also makes cuDNN convolution and max-pooling operate deterministically.\nThis makes Keras Conv*D and MaxPool*D layers operate deterministically in\nboth the forward and backward directions when running on a CUDA-enabled GPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-18\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#breaking-changes-18\"\u003eBreaking Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeletes \u003ccode\u003eOperation.traceback_with_start_lines\u003c/code\u003e for which we know of no\nusages.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved \u003ccode\u003eid\u003c/code\u003e from \u003ccode\u003etf.Tensor.__repr__()\u003c/code\u003e as \u003ccode\u003eid\u003c/code\u003e is not useful other than\ninternal debugging.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSome \u003ccode\u003etf.assert_*\u003c/code\u003e methods now raise assertions at operation creation time\nif the input tensors' values are known at that time, not during the\n\u003ccode\u003esession.run()\u003c/code\u003e. This only changes behavior when the graph execution would\nhave resulted in an error. When this happens, a noop is returned and the\ninput tensors are marked non-feedable. In other words, if they are used as\nkeys in \u003ccode\u003efeed_dict\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003esession.run()\u003c/code\u003e, an error will be raised.\nAlso, because some assert ops don't make it into the graph, the graph\nstructure changes. A different graph can result in different per-op random\nseeds when they are not given explicitly (most often).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe following APIs are not longer experimental:\n\u003ccode\u003etf.config.list_logical_devices\u003c/code\u003e, has been renamed to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.config.LogicalDeviceConfiguration\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.config.experimental_list_devices\u003c/code\u003e has been dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes concurrency issue with \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.parallel_interleave\u003c/code\u003e\nwith \u003ccode\u003esloppy=True\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.dense_to_ragged_batch()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtend \u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e parsing ops to support \u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensors\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix issue where GRU would crash or give incorrect output when a\n\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.Strategy\u003c/code\u003e was used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded option in pybind11.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExport \u003ccode\u003edepthwise_conv2d\u003c/code\u003e in \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.backend\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn Keras Layers and Models, Variables in \u003ccode\u003etrainable_weights\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003enon_trainable_weights\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eweights\u003c/code\u003e are explicitly deduplicated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras \u003ccode\u003emodel.load_weights\u003c/code\u003e now accepts \u003ccode\u003eskip_mismatch\u003c/code\u003e as an argument.\nThis was available in external Keras, and has now been copied over to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix the input shape caching behavior of Keras convolutional layers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eModel.fit_generator\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eModel.evaluate_generator\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eModel.predict_generator\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eModel.train_on_batch\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eModel.test_on_batch\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eModel.predict_on_batch\u003c/code\u003e methods now respect\nthe \u003ccode\u003erun_eagerly\u003c/code\u003e property, and will correctly run using \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e\nby default. Note that \u003ccode\u003eModel.fit_generator\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eModel.evaluate_generator\u003c/code\u003e,\nand \u003ccode\u003eModel.predict_generator\u003c/code\u003e are deprecated endpoints. They are\nsubsumed by \u003ccode\u003eModel.fit\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eModel.evaluate\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eModel.predict\u003c/code\u003e which now\nsupport generators and Sequences.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLegalization for \u003ccode\u003eNMS\u003c/code\u003e ops in TFLite.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eadd \u003ccode\u003enarrow_range\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003equantize_v2\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003edequantize\u003c/code\u003e ops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for \u003ccode\u003eFusedBatchNormV3\u003c/code\u003e in converter.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd an \u003ccode\u003eerrno\u003c/code\u003e-like field to \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e delegate for detecting \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e\nerrors for fallback behaviour.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRefactors \u003ccode\u003eNNAPI\u003c/code\u003e Delegate to support detailed reason why an operation\nis not accelerated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConverts hardswish subgraphs into atomic ops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCritical stability updates for TPUs, especially in cases where the XLA\ncompiler produces compilation errors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTPUs can now be re-initialized multiple times, using\n\u003ccode\u003etf.tpu.experimental.initialize_tpu_system\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensor.merge_dims()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003euniform_row_length\u003c/code\u003e row-partitioning tensor to\n\u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eshape\u003c/code\u003e arg to \u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensor.to_tensor\u003c/code\u003e; Improve speed of\n\u003ccode\u003eRaggedTensor.to_tensor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.io.parse_sequence_example\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.io.parse_single_sequence_example\u003c/code\u003e\nnow support ragged features.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003ewhile_v2\u003c/code\u003e with variables in custom gradient.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport taking gradients of V2 \u003ccode\u003etf.cond\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.while_loop\u003c/code\u003e using\n\u003ccode\u003eLookupTable\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix bug where \u003ccode\u003evectorized_map\u003c/code\u003e failed on inputs with unknown static\nshape.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd preliminary support for sparse CSR matrices.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensor equality with \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e now behaves as expected.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake calls to \u003ccode\u003etf.function(f)()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.function(f).get_concrete_function\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003etf.function(f).get_initialization_function\u003c/code\u003e thread-safe.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtend \u003ccode\u003etf.identity\u003c/code\u003e to work with CompositeTensors (such as\nSparseTensor)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded more \u003ccode\u003edtypes\u003c/code\u003e and zero-sized inputs to \u003ccode\u003eEinsum\u003c/code\u003e Op and improved\nits performance\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable multi-worker \u003ccode\u003eNCCL\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003eall-reduce\u003c/code\u003e inside functions executing\neagerly.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded complex128 support to \u003ccode\u003eRFFT\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRFFT2D\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eRFFT3D\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eIRFFT\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eIRFFT2D\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eIRFFT3D\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003epfor\u003c/code\u003e converter for \u003ccode\u003eSelfAdjointEigV2\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.math.ndtri\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.math.erfinv\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.config.experimental.enable_mlir_bridge\u003c/code\u003e to allow using MLIR\ncompiler bridge in eager model.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for MatrixSolve on Cloud TPU / XLA.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.autodiff.ForwardAccumulator\u003c/code\u003e for \u003ccode\u003e__index__\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.random.uniform\u003c/code\u003e microbenchmark.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUse \u003ccode\u003e_protogen\u003c/code\u003e suffix for proto library targets instead of\n\u003ccode\u003e_cc_protogen\u003c/code\u003e suffix.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMoving the checkpoint reader We do not expect to update the 1.x\nbranch with features, although we will issue patch releases to fix\nvulnerabilities for at least one year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-major-features-and-improvements-20\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#major-features-and-improvements-20\"\u003eMajor Features and Improvements\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAs\n\u003ca href=\"https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/forum/#!topic/developers/iRCt5m4qUz0\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow\u003c/code\u003e pip package will by default include GPU support (same as\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow-gpu\u003c/code\u003e now) for the platforms we currently have GPU support (Linux\nand Windows). It will work on machines with and without Nvidia GPUs.\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow-gpu\u003c/code\u003e will still be available, and CPU-only packages can be\ndownloaded at \u003ccode\u003etensorflow-cpu\u003c/code\u003e for users who are concerned about package\nsize.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow 1.15 contains a complete implementation of the 2.0 API in its\n\u003ccode\u003ecompat.v2\u003c/code\u003e module. It contains a copy of the 1.15 main module (without\n\u003ccode\u003econtrib\u003c/code\u003e) in the \u003ccode\u003ecompat.v1\u003c/code\u003e module. TensorFlow 1.15 is able to emulate 2.0\nbehavior using the \u003ccode\u003eenable_v2_behavior()\u003c/code\u003e function. This enables writing\nforward compatible code: by explicitly importing either\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow.compat.v1\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003etensorflow.compat.v2\u003c/code\u003e, you can ensure that your\ncode works without modifications against an installation of 1.15 or 2.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEagerTensor now supports numpy buffer interface for tensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd toggles \u003ccode\u003etf.enable_control_flow_v2()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.disable_control_flow_v2()\u003c/code\u003e\nfor enabling/disabling v2 control flow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable v2 control flow as part of \u003ccode\u003etf.enable_v2_behavior()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eTF2_BEHAVIOR=1\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutoGraph translates Python control flow into TensorFlow expressions,\nallowing users to write regular Python inside \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e-decorated\nfunctions. AutoGraph is also applied in functions used with \u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e APIS.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds \u003ccode\u003eenable_tensor_equality()\u003c/code\u003e, which switches the behavior such that:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensors are no longer hashable.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensors can be compared with \u003ccode\u003e==\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e!=\u003c/code\u003e, yielding a Boolean Tensor\nwith element-wise comparison results. This will be the default behavior\nin 2.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-19\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#breaking-changes-19\"\u003eBreaking Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorflow code now produces 2 different pip packages: \u003ccode\u003etensorflow_core\u003c/code\u003e\ncontaining all the code (in the future it will contain only the private\nimplementation) and \u003ccode\u003etensorflow\u003c/code\u003e which is a virtual pip package doing\nforwarding to \u003ccode\u003etensorflow_core\u003c/code\u003e (and in the future will contain only the\npublic API of tensorflow). We don't expect this to be breaking, unless you\nwere importing directly from the implementation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow 1.15 is built using devtoolset7 (GCC7) on Ubuntu 16. This may\nlead to ABI incompatibilities with extensions built against earlier versions\nof TensorFlow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecated the use of \u003ccode\u003econstraint=\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e.constraint\u003c/code\u003e with ResourceVariable.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eOMP_NUM_THREADS\u003c/code\u003e is no longer used by the default Keras config. To\nconfigure the number of threads, use \u003ccode\u003etf.config.threading\u003c/code\u003e APIs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.model.save_model\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003emodel.save\u003c/code\u003e now defaults to saving a\nTensorFlow SavedModel.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ekeras.backend.resize_images\u003c/code\u003e (and consequently,\n\u003ccode\u003ekeras.layers.Upsampling2D\u003c/code\u003e) behavior has changed, a bug in the resizing\nimplementation was fixed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLayers now default to \u003ccode\u003efloat32\u003c/code\u003e, and automatically cast their inputs to\nthe layer's dtype. If you had a model that used \u003ccode\u003efloat64\u003c/code\u003e, it will\nprobably silently use \u003ccode\u003efloat32\u003c/code\u003e in TensorFlow2, and a warning will be\nissued that starts with Layer \"layer-name\" is casting an input tensor\nfrom dtype float64 to the layer's dtype of float32. To fix, either set\nthe default dtype to float64 with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.backend.set_floatx('float64')\u003c/code\u003e, or pass \u003ccode\u003edtype='float64'\u003c/code\u003e to\neach of the Layer constructors. See \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.Layer\u003c/code\u003e for more\ninformation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSome \u003ccode\u003etf.assert_*\u003c/code\u003e methods now raise assertions at operation creation\ntime (i.e. when this Python line executes) if the input tensors' values\nare known at that time, not during the session.run(). When this happens,\na noop is returned and the input tensors are marked non-feedable. In\nother words, if they are used as keys in \u003ccode\u003efeed_dict\u003c/code\u003e argument to\n\u003ccode\u003esession.run()\u003c/code\u003e, an error will be raised. Also, because some assert ops\ndon't make it into the graph, the graph structure changes. A different\ngraph can result in different per-op random seeds when they are not\ngiven explicitly (most often).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 supports exporting to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.train.Checkpoint\u003c/code\u003e format, which allows the saved checkpoints to be\ncompatible with \u003ccode\u003emodel.load_weights\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix tests in canned estimators.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose Head as public API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes critical bugs that help with \u003ccode\u003eDenseFeatures\u003c/code\u003e usability in TF2\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePromoting \u003ccode\u003eunbatch\u003c/code\u003e from experimental to core API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding support for datasets as inputs to \u003ccode\u003efrom_tensors\u003c/code\u003e dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator\u003c/code\u003e now supports exporting to\ntf.train.Checkpoint format, which allows the saved checkpoints to be\ncompatible with \u003ccode\u003emodel.load_weights\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSaving a Keras Model using \u003ccode\u003etf.saved_model.save\u003c/code\u003e now saves the list of\nvariables, trainable variables, regularization losses, and the call\nfunction.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecated \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.experimental.export_saved_model\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.experimental.function\u003c/code\u003e. Please use\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.models.save_model(..., save_format='tf')\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.models.load_model\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd an \u003ccode\u003eimplementation=3\u003c/code\u003e mode for \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.LocallyConnected2D\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.LocallyConnected1D\u003c/code\u003e layers using \u003ccode\u003etf.SparseTensor\u003c/code\u003e\nto store weights, allowing a dramatic speedup for large sparse models.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable the Keras compile API \u003ccode\u003eexperimental_run_tf_function\u003c/code\u003e flag by\ndefault. This flag enables single training/eval/predict execution path.\nWith this 1. All input types are converted to \u003ccode\u003eDataset\u003c/code\u003e. 2. When\ndistribution strategy is not specified this goes through the no-op\ndistribution strategy path. 3. Execution is wrapped in tf.function\nunless \u003ccode\u003erun_eagerly=True\u003c/code\u003e is set in compile.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRaise error if \u003ccode\u003ebatch_size\u003c/code\u003e argument is used when input is\ndataset/generator/keras sequence.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eGATHER\u003c/code\u003e support to NN API delegate.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etflite object detection script has a debug mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd delegate support for \u003ccode\u003eQUANTIZE\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded evaluation script for COCO minival.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd delegate support for \u003ccode\u003eQUANTIZED_16BIT_LSTM\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConverts hardswish subgraphs into atomic ops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for defaulting the value of \u003ccode\u003ecycle_length\u003c/code\u003e argument of\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.interleave\u003c/code\u003e to the number of schedulable CPU cores.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eparallel_for\u003c/code\u003e: Add converter for \u003ccode\u003eMatrixDiag\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003enarrow_range\u003c/code\u003e attribute to \u003ccode\u003eQuantizeAndDequantizeV2\u003c/code\u003e and V3.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded new op: \u003ccode\u003etf.strings.unsorted_segment_join\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd HW acceleration support for \u003ccode\u003etopK_v2\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd new \u003ccode\u003eTypeSpec\u003c/code\u003e classes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCloudBigtable version updated to v0.10.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose \u003ccode\u003eHead\u003c/code\u003e as public API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate docstring for gather to properly describe the non-empty \u003ccode\u003ebatch_dims\u003c/code\u003e\ncase.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.sparse.from_dense\u003c/code\u003e utility function.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved ragged tensor support in \u003ccode\u003eTensorFlowTestCase\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMakes the a-normal form transformation in Pyct configurable as to which\nnodes are converted to variables and which are not.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eResizeInputTensor\u003c/code\u003e now works for all delegates.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eEXPAND_DIMS\u003c/code\u003e support to NN API delegate TEST: expand_dims_test\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.cond\u003c/code\u003e emits a StatelessIf op if the branch functions are stateless and\ndo not touch any resources.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.cond\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.while\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eif\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ewhile\u003c/code\u003e in AutoGraph now accept a\nnonscalar predicate if has a single element. This does not affect non-V2\ncontrol flow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.while_loop\u003c/code\u003e emits a StatelessWhile op if the cond and body functions are\nstateless and do correct memory alignment to\n\u003ccode\u003eMemoryAllocation::MemoryAllocation()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtracts \u003ccode\u003eNNAPIDelegateKernel\u003c/code\u003e from nnapi_delegate.cc\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for \u003ccode\u003eFusedBatchNormV3\u003c/code\u003e in converter.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA ragged to dense op for directly calculating tensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix accidental quadratic graph construction cost in graph-mode\n\u003ccode\u003etf.gradients()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-16\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensorFlow 2.0 focuses on \u003cstrong\u003esimplicity\u003c/strong\u003e and \u003cstrong\u003eease of use\u003c/strong\u003e, featuring updates\nlike:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEasy model building with Keras and eager execution.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRobust model deployment in production on any platform.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePowerful experimentation for research.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAPI simplification by reducing duplication and removing deprecated\nendpoints.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFor details on best practices with 2.0, see\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/guide/effective_tf2\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ethe Effective 2.0 guide\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFor information on upgrading your existing TensorFlow 1.x models, please refer\nto our\n\u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/tensorflow/upgrading-your-code-to-tensorflow-2-0-f72c3a4d83b5\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eUpgrade\u003c/a\u003e\nand \u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/guide/migration_guide\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eMigration\u003c/a\u003e guides.\nWe have also released a collection of\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/beta\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003etutorials and getting started guides\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-highlights\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#highlights\"\u003eHighlights\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83
