1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTF 2.0 delivers Keras as the central high level API used to build and train\nmodels. Keras provides several model-building APIs such as Sequential,\nFunctional, and Subclassing along with eager execution, for immediate\niteration and intuitive debugging, and \u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e, for building scalable\ninput pipelines. Checkout\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/guide/keras/overview\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eguide\u003c/a\u003e for additional\ndetails.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDistribution Strategy: TF 2.0 users will be able to use the\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/guide/distribute_strategy\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.Strategy\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\nAPI to distribute training with minimal code changes, yielding great\nout-of-the-box performance. It supports distributed training with Keras\nmodel.fit, as well as with custom training loops. Multi-GPU support is\navailable, along with experimental support for multi worker and Cloud TPUs.\nCheck out the\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/guide/distribute_strategy\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eguide\u003c/a\u003e for more\ndetails.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFunctions, not Sessions. The traditional declarative programming model of\nbuilding a graph and executing it via a \u003ccode\u003etf.Session\u003c/code\u003e is discouraged, and\nreplaced with by writing regular Python functions. Using the \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e\ndecorator, such functions can be turned into graphs which can be executed\nremotely, serialized, and optimized for performance.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUnification of \u003ccode\u003etf.train.Optimizers\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.Optimizers\u003c/code\u003e. Use\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.Optimizers\u003c/code\u003e for TF2.0. \u003ccode\u003ecompute_gradients\u003c/code\u003e is removed as public\nAPI, use \u003ccode\u003eGradientTape\u003c/code\u003e to compute gradients.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutoGraph translates Python control flow into TensorFlow expressions,\nallowing users to write regular Python inside \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e-decorated\nfunctions. AutoGraph is also applied in functions used with tf.data,\ntf.distribute and tf.keras APIs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUnification of exchange formats to SavedModel. All TensorFlow ecosystem\nprojects (TensorFlow Lite, TensorFlow JS, TensorFlow Serving, TensorFlow\nHub) accept SavedModels. Model state should be saved to and restored from\nSavedModels.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAPI Changes: Many API symbols have been renamed or removed, and argument\nnames have changed. Many of these changes are motivated by consistency and\nclarity. The 1.x API remains available in the compat.v1 module. A list of\nall symbol changes can be found\n\u003ca href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1FLFJLzg7WNP6JHODX5q8BDgptKafq_slHpnHVbJIteQ/edit#gid=0\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAPI clean-up, included removing \u003ccode\u003etf.app\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.flags\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003etf.logging\u003c/code\u003e\nin favor of \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/abseil/abseil-py\"\u003eabsl-py\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNo more global variables with helper methods like\n\u003ccode\u003etf.global_variables_initializer\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.get_global_step\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd toggles \u003ccode\u003etf.enable_control_flow_v2()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.disable_control_flow_v2()\u003c/code\u003e\nfor enabling/disabling v2 control flow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable v2 control flow as part of \u003ccode\u003etf.enable_v2_behavior()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eTF2_BEHAVIOR=1\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes autocomplete for most TensorFlow API references by switching to use\nrelative imports in API \u003ccode\u003e__init__.py\u003c/code\u003e files.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAuto Mixed-Precision graph optimizer simplifies converting models to\n\u003ccode\u003efloat16\u003c/code\u003e for acceleration on Volta and Turing Tensor Cores. This feature\ncan be enabled by wrapping an optimizer class with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.train.experimental.enable_mixed_precision_graph_rewrite()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd environment variable \u003ccode\u003eTF_CUDNN_DETERMINISTIC\u003c/code\u003e. Setting to \"true\" or \"1\"\nforces the selection of deterministic cuDNN convolution and max-pooling\nalgorithms. When this is enabled, the algorithm selection procedure itself\nis also deterministic.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-20\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#breaking-changes-20\"\u003eBreaking Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eMany backwards incompatible API changes have been made to clean up the APIs\nand make them more consistent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eToolchains:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow 2.0.0 is built using devtoolset7 (GCC7) on Ubuntu 16. This\nmay lead to ABI incompatibilities with extensions built against earlier\nversions of TensorFlow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorflow code now produces 2 different pip packages: tensorflow_core\ncontaining all the code (in the future it will contain only the private\nimplementation) and tensorflow which is a virtual pip package doing\nforwarding to tensorflow_core (and in the future will contain only the\npublic API of tensorflow). We don't expect this to be breaking, unless\nyou were importing directly from the implementation. Removed the\n\u003ccode\u003efreeze_graph\u003c/code\u003e command line tool; \u003ccode\u003eSavedModel\u003c/code\u003e should be used in place\nof frozen graphs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e has been deprecated, and functionality has been either\nmigrated to the core TensorFlow API, to an ecosystem project such as\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.github.com/tensorflow/addons\"\u003etensorflow/addons\u003c/a\u003e or\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.github.com/tensorflow/io\"\u003etensorflow/io\u003c/a\u003e, or removed\nentirely.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.timeseries\u003c/code\u003e dependency on TF distributions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReplace contrib references with \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.experimental.*\u003c/code\u003e for apis\nin \u003ccode\u003eearly_stopping.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePremade estimators in the tf.estimator.DNN/Linear/DNNLinearCombined\nfamily have been updated to use \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.optimizers\u003c/code\u003e instead of the\n\u003ccode\u003etf.compat.v1.train.Optimizer\u003c/code\u003es. If you do not pass in an \u003ccode\u003eoptimizer=\u003c/code\u003e\narg or if you use a string, the premade estimator will use the Keras\noptimizer. This is checkpoint breaking, as the optimizers have separate\nvariables. A checkpoint converter tool for converting optimizers is\nincluded with the release, but if you want to avoid any change, switch\nto the v1 version of the estimator:\n\u003ccode\u003etf.compat.v1.estimator.DNN/Linear/DNNLinearCombined*\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDefault aggregation for canned Estimators is now \u003ccode\u003eSUM_OVER_BATCH_SIZE\u003c/code\u003e.\nTo maintain previous default behavior, please pass \u003ccode\u003eSUM\u003c/code\u003e as the loss\naggregation method.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCanned Estimators don’t support \u003ccode\u003einput_layer_partitioner\u003c/code\u003e arg in the\nAPI. If you have this arg, you will have to switch to \u003ccode\u003etf.compat.v1 canned Estimators\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEstimator.export_savedmodel\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eexport_saved_model\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWhen saving to SavedModel, Estimators will strip default op attributes.\nThis is almost always the correct behavior, as it is more forwards\ncompatible, but if you require that default attributes to be saved with\nthe model, please use \u003ccode\u003etf.compat.v1.Estimator\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFeature Columns have been upgraded to be more Eager-friendly and to work\nwith Keras. As a result, \u003ccode\u003etf.feature_column.input_layer\u003c/code\u003e has been\ndeprecated in favor of \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.DenseFeatures\u003c/code\u003e. v1 feature\ncolumns have direct analogues in v2 except for\n\u003ccode\u003eshared_embedding_columns\u003c/code\u003e, which are not cross-compatible with v1 and\nv2. Use \u003ccode\u003etf.feature_column.shared_embeddings\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eOMP_NUM_THREADS\u003c/code\u003e is no longer used by the default Keras config. To\nconfigure the number of threads, use \u003ccode\u003etf.config.threading\u003c/code\u003e APIs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.model.save_model\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003emodel.save\u003c/code\u003e now defaults to saving a\nTensorFlow SavedModel. HDF5 files are still supported.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecated \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.experimental.export_saved_model\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.experimental.function\u003c/code\u003e. Please use\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.models.save_model(..., save_format='tf')\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.models.load_model\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLayers now default to float32, and automatically cast their inputs to\nthe layer's dtype. If you had a model that used float64, it will\nprobably silently use float32 in TensorFlow 2, and a warning will be\nissued that starts with \u003ccode\u003eLayer \u0026lt;layer-name\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e is casting an input tensor\nfrom dtype float64 to the layer's dtype of float32. To fix, either set\nthe default dtype to float64 with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.backend.set_floatx('float64')\u003c/code\u003e, or pass \u003ccode\u003edtype='float64'\u003c/code\u003e to\neach of the Layer constructors. See \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.Layer\u003c/code\u003e for more\ninformation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved \u003ccode\u003elite.OpHint\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003elite.experimental\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003elite.constant\u003c/code\u003e from 2.0\nAPI.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensors are no longer hashable, but instead compare element-wise with \u003ccode\u003e==\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003e!=\u003c/code\u003e. Use \u003ccode\u003etf.compat.v1.disable_tensor_equality()\u003c/code\u003e to return to the\nprevious behavior.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePerforming equality operations on Tensors or Variables with incompatible\nshapes an exception is no longer thrown. Instead \u003ccode\u003e__eq__\u003c/code\u003e returns False and\n\u003ccode\u003e__ne__\u003c/code\u003e returns True.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRemoved \u003ccode\u003etf.string_split\u003c/code\u003e from v2 API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDeprecated the use of \u003ccode\u003econstraint=\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e.constraint\u003c/code\u003e with ResourceVariable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eUnifiedGRU\u003c/code\u003e as the new GRU implementation for tf2.0. Change the default\nrecurrent activation function for GRU from \u003ccode\u003ehard_sigmoid\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003esigmoid\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003ereset_after\u003c/code\u003e to True in 2.0. Historically recurrent activation is\n\u003ccode\u003ehard_sigmoid\u003c/code\u003e since it is fast than 'sigmoid'. With new unified backend\nbetween CPU and GPU mode, since the CuDNN kernel is using sigmoid, we change\nthe default for CPU mode to sigmoid as well. With that, the default GRU will\nbe compatible with both CPU and GPU kernel. This will enable user with GPU\nto use CuDNN kernel by default and get a 10x performance boost in training.\nNote that this is checkpoint breaking change. If user want to use their 1.x\npre-trained checkpoint, please construct the layer with\nGRU(recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', reset_after=False) to fallback to\n1.x behavior.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCUDNN_INSTALL_PATH\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTENSORRT_INSTALL_PATH\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eNCCL_INSTALL_PATH\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eNCCL_HDR_PATH\u003c/code\u003e are deprecated. Use \u003ccode\u003eTF_CUDA_PATHS\u003c/code\u003e instead which supports a\ncomma-separated list of base paths that are searched to find CUDA libraries\nand headers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRefer to our\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/orgs/tensorflow/projects/4\"\u003epublic project status tracker\u003c/a\u003e\nand\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A2.0\"\u003eissues tagged with \u003ccode\u003e2.0\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\non GitHub for insight into recent issues and development progress.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you experience any snags when using TF 2.0, please let us know at the\n\u003ca href=\"https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/forum/?utm_medium=email\u0026amp;utm_source=footer#!forum/testing\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTF 2.0 Testing User Group\u003c/a\u003e.\nWe have a support mailing list as well as weekly testing meetings, and would\nlove to hear your migration feedback and questions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.proto.*\u003c/code\u003e ops in \u003ccode\u003etf.io\u003c/code\u003e (they will exist in TF2)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for TensorArrays to \u003ccode\u003etf.data Dataset\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntegrate Ragged Tensors with \u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAll core and experimental tf.data transformations that input\nuser-defined functions can span multiple devices now.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtending the TF 2.0 support for \u003ccode\u003eshuffle(..., reshuffle_each_iteration=True)\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ecache()\u003c/code\u003e to work across different\nPython iterators for the same dataset.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoving the \u003ccode\u003eexperimental_numa_aware\u003c/code\u003e option from \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Options\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003enum_parallel_reads\u003c/code\u003e and passing in a Dataset containing filenames\ninto \u003ccode\u003eTextLineDataset\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFixedLengthRecordDataset\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for defaulting the value of \u003ccode\u003ecycle_length\u003c/code\u003e argument of\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.interleave\u003c/code\u003e to the number of schedulable CPU cores.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePromoting \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.enumerate_dataset\u003c/code\u003e to core as\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.enumerate\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePromoting \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.unbatch\u003c/code\u003e to core as\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.unbatch\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds option for introducing slack in the pipeline to reduce CPU\ncontention, via \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Options().experimental_slack = True\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded experimental support for parallel batching to \u003ccode\u003ebatch()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003epadded_batch()\u003c/code\u003e. This functionality can be enabled through\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Options()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport cancellation of long-running \u003ccode\u003ereduce\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNow we use \u003ccode\u003edataset\u003c/code\u003e node name as prefix instead of the op name, to\nidentify the component correctly in metrics, for pipelines with repeated\ncomponents.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove the performance of datasets using \u003ccode\u003efrom_tensors()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePromoting \u003ccode\u003eunbatch\u003c/code\u003e from experimental to core API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding support for datasets as inputs to \u003ccode\u003efrom_tensors\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003efrom_tensor_slices\u003c/code\u003e and batching and unbatching of nested datasets.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.distribute\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable \u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.experimental.MultiWorkerMirroredStrategy\u003c/code\u003e working\nin eager mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCallbacks are supported in \u003ccode\u003eMultiWorkerMirroredStrategy\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDisable \u003ccode\u003erun_eagerly\u003c/code\u003e and distribution strategy if there are symbolic\ntensors added to the model using \u003ccode\u003eadd_metric\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eadd_loss\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLoss and gradients should now more reliably be correctly scaled w.r.t.\nthe global batch size when using a \u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.Strategy\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSet default loss reduction as \u003ccode\u003eAUTO\u003c/code\u003e for improving reliability of loss\nscaling with distribution strategy and custom training loops. \u003ccode\u003eAUTO\u003c/code\u003e\nindicates that the reduction option will be determined by the usage\ncontext. For almost all cases this defaults to \u003ccode\u003eSUM_OVER_BATCH_SIZE\u003c/code\u003e.\nWhen used in distribution strategy scope, outside of built-in training\nloops such as \u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003efit\u003c/code\u003e, we expect reduction value\nto be 'None' or 'SUM'. Using other values will raise an error.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport for multi-host \u003ccode\u003encclAllReduce\u003c/code\u003e in Distribution Strategy.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReplace \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.add_metrics\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.add_metrics\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUse \u003ccode\u003etf.compat.v1.estimator.inputs\u003c/code\u003e instead of \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.inputs\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReplace contrib references with \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.experimental.*\u003c/code\u003e for apis\nin early_s in Estimator\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCanned Estimators will now use keras optimizers by default. An error\nwill be raised if tf.train.Optimizers are used, and you will have to\nswitch to tf.keras.optimizers or tf.compat.v1 canned Estimators.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA checkpoint converter for canned Estimators has been provided to\ntransition canned Estimators that are warm started from\n\u003ccode\u003etf.train.Optimizers\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.optimizers\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLosses are scaled in canned estimator v2 and not in the optimizers\nanymore. If you are using Estimator + distribution strategy + optimikzer\nv1 then the behavior does not change. This implies that if you are using\ncustom estimator with optimizer v2, you have to scale losses. We have\nnew utilities to help scale losses \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.compute_average_loss\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.scale_regularization_loss\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePremade models (including Linear and WideDeep) have been introduced for\nthe purpose of replacing Premade estimators.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eModel saving changes\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003emodel.save\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.saved_model.save\u003c/code\u003e may now save to the TensorFlow\nSavedModel format. The model can be restored using\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.models.load_model\u003c/code\u003e. HDF5 files are still supported, and may be\nused by specifying \u003ccode\u003esave_format=\"h5\"\u003c/code\u003e when saving.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRaw TensorFlow functions can now be used in conjunction with the Keras\nFunctional API during model creation. This obviates the need for users\nto create Lambda layers in most cases when using the Functional API.\nLike Lambda layers, TensorFlow functions that result in Variable\ncreation or assign ops are not supported.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for passing list of lists to the \u003ccode\u003emetrics\u003c/code\u003e argument in Keras\n\u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.AbstractRNNCell\u003c/code\u003e as the preferred implementation\nfor RNN cells in TF v2. User can use it to implement RNN cells with\ncustom behavior.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras training and validation curves are shown on the same plot when\nusing the TensorBoard callback.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSwitched Keras \u003ccode\u003efit/evaluate/predict\u003c/code\u003e execution to use only a single\nunified path by default unless eager execution has been explicitly\ndisabled, regardless of input type. This unified path places an\neager-friendly training step inside of a \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e. With this\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAll input types are converted to \u003ccode\u003eDataset\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe path assumes there is always a distribution strategy. when\ndistribution strategy is not specified the path uses a no-op\ndistribution strategy.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe training step is wrapped in \u003ccode\u003etf.function\u003c/code\u003e unless \u003ccode\u003erun_eagerly=True\u003c/code\u003e\nis set in compile. The single path execution code does not yet support\nall use cases. We fallback to the existing v1 execution paths if your\nmodel contains the following:\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003esample_weight_mode\u003c/code\u003e in compile\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eweighted_metrics\u003c/code\u003e in compile\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ev1 optimizer\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etarget tensors in compile If you are experiencing any issues because\nof this change, please inform us (file an issue) about your use case\nand you can unblock yourself by setting\n\u003ccode\u003eexperimental_run_tf_function=False\u003c/code\u003e in compile meanwhile. We have\nseen couple of use cases where the model usage pattern is not as\nexpected and would not work with this change.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eoutput tensors of one layer is used in the constructor of another.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003esymbolic tensors outside the scope of the model are used in custom loss\nfunctions. The flag can be disabled for these cases and ideally the\nusage pattern will need to be fixed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMark Keras \u003ccode\u003eset_session\u003c/code\u003e as \u003ccode\u003ecompat.v1\u003c/code\u003e only.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator\u003c/code\u003e now supports exporting to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.train.Checkpoint format\u003c/code\u003e, which allows the saved checkpoints to be\ncompatible with \u003ccode\u003emodel.load_weights\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ekeras.backend.resize_images\u003c/code\u003e (and consequently,\n\u003ccode\u003ekeras.layers.Upsampling2D\u003c/code\u003e) behavior has changed, a bug in the resizing\nimplementation was fixed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd an \u003ccode\u003eimplementation=3\u003c/code\u003e mode for \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.LocallyConnected2D\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.LocallyConnected1D\u003c/code\u003e layers using \u003ccode\u003etf.SparseTensor\u003c/code\u003e\nto store weights, allowing a dramatic speedup for large sparse models.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRaise error if \u003ccode\u003ebatch_size\u003c/code\u003e argument is used when input is\ndataset/generator/keras sequence.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate TF 2.0 \u003ccode\u003ekeras.backend.name_scope\u003c/code\u003e to use TF 2.0 \u003ccode\u003ename_scope\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd v2 module aliases for losses, metrics, initializers and optimizers:\n\u003ccode\u003etf.losses = tf.keras.losses\u003c/code\u003e \u0026amp; \u003ccode\u003etf.metrics = tf.keras.metrics\u003c/code\u003e \u0026amp;\n\u003ccode\u003etf.initializers = tf.keras.initializers\u003c/code\u003e \u0026amp; \u003ccode\u003etf.optimizers = tf.keras.optimizers\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates binary cross entropy logic in Keras when input is probabilities.\nInstead of converting probabilities to logits, we are using the cross\nentropy formula for probabilities.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded public APIs for \u003ccode\u003ecumsum\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ecumprod\u003c/code\u003e keras backend functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for temporal sample weight mode in subclassed models.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRaise \u003ccode\u003eValueError\u003c/code\u003e if an integer is passed to the training APIs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded fault-tolerance support for training Keras model via \u003ccode\u003emodel.fit()\u003c/code\u003e\nwith \u003ccode\u003eMultiWorkerMirroredStrategy\u003c/code\u003e, tutorial available.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCustom Callback tutorial is now available.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTo train with \u003ccode\u003etf.distribute\u003c/code\u003e, Keras API is recommended over estimator.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003esteps_per_epoch\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003esteps\u003c/code\u003e arguments are supported with numpy arrays.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew error message when unexpected keys are used in\nsample_weight/class_weight dictionaries\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLosses are scaled in Keras compile/fit and not in the optimizers\nanymore. If you are using custom training loop, we have new utilities to\nhelp scale losses \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.compute_average_loss\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.scale_regularization_loss\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLayer\u003c/code\u003e apply and add_variable APIs are deprecated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for channels first data format in cross entropy losses\nwith logits and support for tensors with unknown ranks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eError messages will be raised if \u003ccode\u003eadd_update\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eadd_metric\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eadd_loss\u003c/code\u003e,\nactivity regularizers are used inside of a control flow branch.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew loss reduction types:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAUTO\u003c/code\u003e: Indicates that the reduction option will be determined by the\nusage context. For almost all cases this defaults to\n\u003ccode\u003eSUM_OVER_BATCH_SIZE\u003c/code\u003e. When used with \u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.Strategy\u003c/code\u003e, outside\nof built-in training loops such as \u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003efit\u003c/code\u003e, we\nexpect reduction value to be \u003ccode\u003eSUM\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eNONE\u003c/code\u003e. Using \u003ccode\u003eAUTO\u003c/code\u003e in that case\nwill raise an error.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eNONE\u003c/code\u003e: Weighted losses with one dimension reduced (axis=-1, or axis\nspecified by loss function). When this reduction type used with built-in\nKeras training loops like \u003ccode\u003efit\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003eevaluate\u003c/code\u003e, the unreduced vector loss is\npassed to the optimizer but the reported loss will be a scalar value.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSUM\u003c/code\u003e: Scalar sum of weighted losses. 4. \u003ccode\u003eSUM_OVER_BATCH_SIZE\u003c/code\u003e: Scalar\n\u003ccode\u003eSUM\u003c/code\u003e divided by number of elements in losses. This reduction type is\nnot supported when used with \u003ccode\u003etf.distribute.Strategy\u003c/code\u003e outside of\nbuilt-in training loops like \u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003efit\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWraps losses passed to the \u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e API (strings and v1 losses) which\nare not instances of v2 \u003ccode\u003eLoss\u003c/code\u003e class in \u003ccode\u003eLossWrapper\u003c/code\u003e class. =\u0026gt; All\nlosses will now use \u003ccode\u003eSUM_OVER_BATCH_SIZE\u003c/code\u003e reduction as default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003emodel.add_loss(symbolic_tensor)\u003c/code\u003e should work in ambient eager.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate metric name to always reflect what the user has given in compile.\nAffects following cases\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWhen name is given as 'accuracy'/'crossentropy'\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWhen an aliased function name is used eg. 'mse'\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoving the \u003ccode\u003eweighted\u003c/code\u003e prefix from weighted metric names.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow non-Tensors through v2 losses.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd v2 sparse categorical crossentropy metric.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd v2 APIs for \u003ccode\u003eAUCCurve\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eAUCSummationMethod\u003c/code\u003e enums.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eadd_update\u003c/code\u003e can now be passed a zero-arg callable in order to support\nturning off the update when setting \u003ccode\u003etrainable=False\u003c/code\u003e on a Layer of a\nModel compiled with \u003ccode\u003erun_eagerly=True\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eStandardize the LayerNormalization API by replacing the args \u003ccode\u003enorm_axis\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003eparams_axis\u003c/code\u003e with \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed critical bugs that help with DenseFeatures usability in TF2\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.lite\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded evaluation script for \u003ccode\u003eCOCO\u003c/code\u003e minival\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd delegate support for \u003ccode\u003eQUANTIZE\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eGATHER\u003c/code\u003e support to NN API delegate.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for TFLiteConverter Python API in 2.0. Contains functions\nfrom_saved_model, from_keras_file, and from_concrete_functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eEXPAND_DIMS\u003c/code\u003e support to NN API delegate TEST.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003enarrow_range\u003c/code\u003e attribute to QuantizeAndDequantizeV2 and V3.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for \u003ccode\u003etflite_convert\u003c/code\u003e command line tool in 2.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePost-training quantization tool supports quantizing weights shared by\nmultiple operations. The models made with versions of this tool will use\nINT8 types for weights and will only be executable interpreters from\nthis version onwards.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePost-training quantization tool supports fp16 weights and GPU delegate\nacceleration for fp16.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd delegate support for \u003ccode\u003eQUANTIZED_16BIT_LSTM\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtracts \u003ccode\u003eNNAPIDelegateKernel\u003c/code\u003e from nnapi_delegate.cc\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensorRT\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd TensorFlow 2.0-compatible \u003ccode\u003eTrtGraphConverterV2\u003c/code\u003e API for TensorRT\nconversion. Now the\nfunction must be accessed from the saved model.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003econverter.calibrate()\u003c/code\u003e method has been removed. resources.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support of local soft device placement for eager op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePass partial_pivoting to the \u003ccode\u003e_TridiagonalSolveGrad\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd HW acceleration support for \u003ccode\u003eLogSoftMax\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd guard to avoid acceleration of L2 Normalization with input rank != 4\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix memory allocation problem when calling \u003ccode\u003eAddNewInputConstantTensor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDelegate application failure leaves interpreter in valid state\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.while_loop\u003c/code\u003e emits a StatelessWhile op if the cond and body functions\nare stateless and do not touch any resources.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.cond\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.while\u003c/code\u003e and if and while in AutoGraph now accept a\nnonscalar predicate if has a single element. This does not affect non-V2\ncontrol flow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix potential security vulnerability where decoding variant tensors from\nproto could result in heap out of bounds memory access.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOnly create a GCS directory object if the object does not already exist.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduce \u003ccode\u003edynamic\u003c/code\u003e constructor argument in Layer and Model, which\nshould be set to \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e when using imperative control flow in the \u003ccode\u003ecall\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBegin adding Go wrapper for C Eager API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eXLA HLO graphs can be inspected with interactive_graphviz tool now.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd dataset ops to the graph (or create kernels in Eager execution)\nduring the python Dataset object creation instead doing it during\nIterator creation time.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003ebatch_dims\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003etf.gather\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe behavior of \u003ccode\u003etf.gather\u003c/code\u003e is now correct when \u003ccode\u003eaxis=None\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003ebatch_dims\u0026lt;0\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate docstring for gather to properly describe the non-empty\n\u003ccode\u003ebatch_dims\u003c/code\u003e case.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoving of dtype in the constructor of initializers and partition_info\nin call.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.math.nextafter\u003c/code\u003e op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTurn on MKL-DNN contraction kernels by default. MKL-DNN dynamically\ndispatches the best kernel implementation based on CPU vector\narchitecture. To disable them, build with\n\u003ccode\u003e--define=tensorflow_mkldnn_contraction_kernel=0\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.linspace(start, stop, num)\u003c/code\u003e now always uses \"stop\" as last value\n(for num \u0026gt; 1)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded top-k to precision and recall to keras metrics.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a ragged size op and register it to the op dispatcher\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTransitive dependencies on :\u003ccode\u003epooling_ops\u003c/code\u003e were removed. Some users may\nneed to add explicit dependencies on :\u003ccode\u003epooling_ops\u003c/code\u003e if they reference\nthe operators from that library.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eCompositeTensor\u003c/code\u003e base class.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMalformed gif images could result in an access out of bounds in the\ncolor palette of the frame. This has been fixed now\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd templates and interfaces for creating lookup tables\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTensor::UnsafeCopyFromInternal\u003c/code\u003e deprecated in favor\n\u003ccode\u003eTensor::BitcastFrom\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn \u003ccode\u003emap_vectorization\u003c/code\u003e optimization, reduce the degree of parallelism in\nthe vectorized map node.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd variant wrapper for \u003ccode\u003eabsl::string_view\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd OpKernels for some stateless maps.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDType is no longer convertible to an int. Use \u003ccode\u003edtype.as_datatype_enum\u003c/code\u003e\ninstead of \u003ccode\u003eint(dtype)\u003c/code\u003e to get the same result.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport both binary and -1/1 label input in v2 hinge and squared hinge\nlosses.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eLinearOperator.adjoint\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLinearOperator.H\u003c/code\u003e (alias).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose CriticalSection in core as \u003ccode\u003etf.CriticalSection\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnhanced graphviz output.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd opkernel templates for common table operations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix callbacks do not log values in eager mode when a deferred build\nmodel is used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSignatureDef\u003c/code\u003e util functions have been deprecated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate \u003ccode\u003eFingerprint64Map\u003c/code\u003e to use aliases\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd legacy string flat hash map op kernels.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for \u003ccode\u003eadd_metric\u003c/code\u003e in the graph function mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdating cosine similarity loss - removed the negate sign from cosine\nsimilarity.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanged default for gradient accumulation for TPU embeddings to true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds summary trace API for collecting graph and profile information.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eprecision_mode\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003eTrtGraphConverter\u003c/code\u003e is now case\ninsensitive.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-17\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis is the first 1.x release containing the compat.v2 module. This module\nis required to allow libraries to publish code which works in both 1.x and\n2.x. After this release, no backwards incompatible changes are allowed in\nthe 2.0 Python API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTurn on MKL-DNN contraction kernels by default. MKL-DNN dynamically\ndispatches the best kernel implementation based on CPU vector architecture.\nTo disable them, build with --define=tensorflow_mkldnn_contraction_kernel=0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-behavioral-changes\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#behavioral-changes\"\u003eBehavioral changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSet default loss reduction as \u003ccode\u003eAUTO\u003c/code\u003e for improving reliability of loss\nscaling with distribution strategy and custom training loops. \u003ccode\u003eAUTO\u003c/code\u003e\nindicates that the reduction option will be determined by the usage context.\nFor almost all cases this defaults to \u003ccode\u003eSUM_OVER_BATCH_SIZE\u003c/code\u003e. When used in\ndistribution strategy scope, outside of built-in training loops such as\n\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003efit\u003c/code\u003e, we expect reduction value to be 'None' or\n'SUM'. Using other values will raise an error.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWraps losses passed to the \u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e API (strings and v1 losses) which are\nnot instances of v2 \u003ccode\u003eLoss\u003c/code\u003e class in \u003ccode\u003eLossWrapper\u003c/code\u003e class. =\u0026gt; All losses will\nnow use \u003ccode\u003eSUM_OVER_BATCH_SIZE\u003c/code\u003e reduction as default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDisable \u003ccode\u003erun_eagerly\u003c/code\u003e and distribution strategy if there are symbolic\ntensors added to the model using \u003ccode\u003eadd_metric\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eadd_loss\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.linspace(start, stop, num) now always uses \"stop\" as last value (for\nnum \u0026gt; 1)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eResourceVariable\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eVariable\u003c/code\u003e no longer accepts \u003ccode\u003econstraint\u003c/code\u003e in the\nconstructor, nor expose it as a @property.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe behavior of tf.gather is now correct when axis=None and batch_dims\u0026lt;0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOnly create a GCS directory object if the object does not already exist.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn \u003ccode\u003emap_vectorization\u003c/code\u003e optimization, reduce the degree of parallelism in the\nvectorized map node.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBug fix: loss and gradients should now more reliably be correctly scaled\nw.r.t. the global batch size when using a tf.distribute.Strategy.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdating cosine similarity loss - removed the negate sign from cosine\nsimilarity.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDType is no longer convertible to an int. Use dtype.as_datatype_enum instead\nof int(dtype) to get the same result.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanged default for gradient accumulation for TPU embeddings to true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCallbacks now log values in eager mode when a deferred build model is used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTransitive dependencies on :pooling_ops were removed. Some users may need to\nadd explicit dependencies on :pooling_ops if they reference the operators\nfrom that library.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.keras.optimizers default learning rate changes:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdadelta: 1.000 to 0.001\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdagrad: 0.01 to 0.001\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdamax: 0.002 to for:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.initializers =\u0026gt; tf.keras.initializers\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.losses =\u0026gt; tf.keras.losses \u0026amp; tf.metrics =\u0026gt; tf.keras.metrics\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.optimizers =\u0026gt; tf.keras.optimizers\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd tf.keras.layers.AbstractRNNCell as the preferred implementation of\nRNN cell for TF v2. User can use it to implement RNN cell with custom\nbehavior.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding \u003ccode\u003eclear_losses\u003c/code\u003e API to be able to clear losses at the end of\nforward pass in a custom training loop in eager.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for passing list of lists to the \u003ccode\u003emetrics\u003c/code\u003e param in Keras\n\u003ccode\u003ecompile\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded top-k to precision and recall to keras metrics.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding public APIs for \u003ccode\u003ecumsum\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ecumprod\u003c/code\u003e keras backend functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix: model.add_loss(symbolic_tensor) should work in ambient eager.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd name argument to tf.string_split and tf.strings_split\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMinor change to SavedModels exported from Keras using\ntf.keras.experimental.export. (SignatureDef key for evaluation mode is\nnow \"eval\" instead of \"test\"). This will be reverted back to \"test\" in\nthe near future.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates binary cross entropy logic in Keras when input is probabilities.\nInstead of converting probabilities to logits, we are using the cross\nentropy formula for probabilities.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRaw TensorFlow functions can now be used in conjunction with the Keras\nFunctional API during model creation. This obviates the need for users\nto create Lambda layers in most cases when using the Functional API.\nLike Lambda layers, TensorFlow functions that result in Variable\ncreation or assign ops are not supported.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras training and validation curves are shown on the same plot.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduce \u003ccode\u003edynamic\u003c/code\u003e constructor argument in Layer and Model, which\nshould be set to True when using imperative control flow in the \u003ccode\u003ecall\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoving of dtype in the constructor of initializers and partition_info\nin call.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew ops and improved op functionality\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd OpKernels for some stateless maps\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd v2 APIs for AUCCurve and AUCSummationMethod\nenums. #tf-metrics-convergence\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd tf.math.nextafter op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd CompositeTensor base class.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd tf.linalg.tridiagonal_solve op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd opkernel templates for common table operations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for TFLite in TensorFlow 2.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds summary trace API for collecting graph and profile information.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd batch_dims argument to tf.gather.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for \u003ccode\u003eadd_metric\u003c/code\u003e in the graph function mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd C++ Gradient for BatchMatMulV2.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded tf.random.binomial\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded gradient for SparseToDense op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd legacy string flat hash map op kernels\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a ragged size op and register it to the op dispatcher\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd broadcasting support to tf.matmul.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd ellipsis (...) support for tf.einsum()\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded LinearOperator.adjoint and LinearOperator.H (alias).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded GPU implementation of tf.linalg.tridiagonal_solve.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded strings.byte_split\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd RaggedTensor.placeholder()\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a new \"result_type\" parameter to tf.strings.split\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eadd_update\u003c/code\u003e can now be passed a zero-arg callable in order to support\nturning off the update when setting \u003ccode\u003etrainable=False\u003c/code\u003e on a Layer of a\nModel compiled with \u003ccode\u003erun_eagerly=True\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd variant wrapper for absl::string_view\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd expand_composites argument to all nest.* methods.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd pfor converter for Squeeze.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBug fix for tf.tile gradient\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose CriticalSection in core as tf.CriticalSection.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate Fingerprint64Map to use aliases\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eResourceVariable support for gather_nd.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eResourceVariable's gather op supports batch dimensions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVariadic reduce is supported on CPU\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtend tf.function with basic support for CompositeTensors arguments\n(such as SparseTensor and RaggedTensor).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd templates and interfaces for creating lookup tables\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePost-training quantization tool supports quantizing weights shared by\nmultiple operations. The models made with versions of this tool will use\nINT8 types for weights and will only be executable interpreters from\nthis version onwards.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMalformed gif images could result in an access out of bounds in the\ncolor palette of the frame. This has been fixed now\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eimage.resize now considers proper pixel centers and has new kernels\n(incl. anti-aliasing).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded an isotonic regression solver (tf.nn.isotonic_regression).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTurn on MKL-DNN contraction kernels by default. MKL-DNN dynamically\ndispatches the best kernel implementation based on CPU vector\narchitecture. To disable them, build with\n--define=tensorflow_mkldnn_contraction_kernel=0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport for multi-host ncclAllReduce in Distribution Strategy.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose a flag that allows the number of threads to vary across Python\nbenchmarks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow 2.0 Development\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd v2 sparse categorical crossentropy metric.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow non-Tensors through v2 losses.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd UnifiedGRU as the new GRU implementation for tf2.0. Change the\ndefault recurrent activation function for GRU from 'hard_sigmoid' to\n'sigmoid', and 'reset_after' to True in 2.0. Historically recurrent\nactivation is 'hard_sigmoid' since it is fast than 'sigmoid'. With new\nunified backend between CPU and GPU mode, since the CuDNN kernel is\nusing sigmoid, we change the default for CPU mode to sigmoid as well.\nWith that, the default GRU will be compatible with both CPU and GPU\nkernel. This will enable user with GPU to use CuDNN kernel by default\nand get a 10x performance boost in training. Note that this is\ncheckpoint breaking change. If user want to use their 1.x pre-trained\ncheckpoint, please construct the layer with\nGRU(recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', reset_after=False) to fallback\nto 1.x behavior.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTF 2.0 - Update metric name to always reflect what the user has given in\ncompile. Affects following cases 1. When name is given as\n'accuracy'/'crossentropy' 2. When an aliased function name is used eg.\n'mse' 3. Removing the \u003ccode\u003eweighted\u003c/code\u003e prefix from weighted metric names.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBegin adding Go wrapper for C Eager API\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eimage.resize in 2.0 now supports gradients for the new resize kernels.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eremoved tf.string_split from v2 API\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose tf.contrib.proto.* ops in tf.io (they will exist in TF2)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\"Updates the TFLiteConverter API in 2.0. Changes from_concrete_function\nto from_concrete_functions.\"\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable tf.distribute.experimental.MultiWorkerMirroredStrategy working in\neager mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport both binary and -1/1 label input in v2 hinge and squared hinge\nlosses.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow Lite\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\"Adds support for tflite_convert in 2.0.\"\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\"Remove lite.OpHint, lite.experimental, and lite.constant from 2.0 API.\"\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.contrib\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded Neural Turing Implementation as described in\n\u003ca href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/1807.08518\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://arxiv.org/abs/1807.08518\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove tf.contrib.timeseries dependency on TF distributions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.data\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd num_parallel_reads and passing in a Dataset containing filenames\ninto TextLineDataset and FixedLengthRecordDataset\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoing forward we operate in TF 2.0, this change is part of the effort to\nslowly converting XYZDataset to DatasetV2 type which is the official\nversion going to be used in TF 2.0 and motivated by some compatibility\nissue found, _BigtableXYZDataset (of type DatasetV2) does not implement\nthe _as_variant_tensor() of DatasetV1, when moving contrib.bigtable to\ntensorflow_io. Converting into DatasetV2 removes the overheads to\nmaintain V1 while we are moving into TF 2.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd dataset ops to the graph (or create kernels in Eager execution)\nduring the python Dataset object creation instead doing it during\nIterator creation time.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for TensorArrays to tf.data Dataset.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSwitching tf.data functions to use \u003ccode\u003edefun\u003c/code\u003e, providing an escape hatch to\ncontinue using the legacy \u003ccode\u003eDefun\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eToolchains\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCUDNN_INSTALL_PATH, TENSORRT_INSTALL_PATH, NCCL_INSTALL_PATH,\nNCCL_HDR_PATH are deprecated. Use TF_CUDA_PATHS instead which supports a\ncomma-separated list of base paths that are searched to find CUDA\nlibraries and headers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTF code now resides in \u003ccode\u003etensorflow_core\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etensorflow\u003c/code\u003e is just a\nvirtual pip package. No code changes are needed for projects using\nTensorFlow, the change is transparent\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eXLA\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eXLA HLO graphs can be inspected with interactive_graphviz tool now.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEstimator\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUse tf.compat.v1.estimator.inputs instead of tf.estimator.inputs\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReplace contrib references with tf.estimator.experimental.* for apis in\nearly_stopping.py\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-18\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca other integer types) in \u003ccode\u003etf.constant\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake the \u003ccode\u003egain\u003c/code\u003e argument of convolutional orthogonal initializers\n(\u003ccode\u003econvolutional_delta_orthogonal\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003econvolutional_orthogonal_1D\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003econvolutional_orthogonal_2D\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003econvolutional_orthogonal_3D\u003c/code\u003e) have\nconsistent behavior with the \u003ccode\u003etf.initializers.orthogonal\u003c/code\u003e initializer, i.e.\nscale the output l2-norm by \u003ccode\u003egain\u003c/code\u003e and NOT by \u003ccode\u003esqrt(gain)\u003c/code\u003e. (Note that these\nfunctions are currently in \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e which is not guaranteed backward\ncompatible).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-bug-fixes-and-other-changes-40\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#bug-fixes-and-other-changes-40\"\u003eBug Fixes and Other Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDocumentation\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate the doc with the details about the rounding mode used in\nquantize_and_dequantize_v2.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eClarify that tensorflow::port::InitMain() \u003cem\u003eshould\u003c/em\u003e be called before\nusing the TensorFlow library. Programs failing to do this are not\nportable to all platforms.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecations and Symbol renames.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoving deprecations for the following endpoints: \u003ccode\u003etf.acos\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.acosh\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.add\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.as_string\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.asin\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.asinh\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.atan\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.atan2\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.atanh\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.cos\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.cosh\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.equal\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.exp\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.floor\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.greater\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.greater_equal\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.less\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.less_equal\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.log\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.logp1\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.logical_and\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.logical_not\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.logical_or\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.maximum\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.minimum\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.not_equal\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.sin\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.sinh\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.tan\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.shard\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate \u003ccode\u003esaved_model.loader.load\u003c/code\u003e which is replaced by\n\u003ccode\u003esaved_model.load\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003esaved_model.main_op\u003c/code\u003e, which will be replaced by\n\u003ccode\u003esaved_model.main_op\u003c/code\u003e in V2.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate tf.QUANTIZED_DTYPES. The official new symbol is\ntf.dtypes.QUANTIZED_DTYPES.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate sklearn imports for deprecated packages.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate \u003ccode\u003eVariable.count_up_to\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.count_up_to\u003c/code\u003e in favor of\n\u003ccode\u003eDataset.range\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExport \u003ccode\u003econfusion_matrix\u003c/code\u003e op as \u003ccode\u003etf.math.confusion_matrix\u003c/code\u003e instead of\n\u003ccode\u003etf.train.confusion_matrix\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.dtypes.\u003c/code\u003e endpoint for every constant in dtypes.py. Moving\nendpoints in versions.py to corresponding endpoints in \u003ccode\u003etf.sysconfig.\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003etf.version.\u003c/code\u003e. Moving all constants under \u003ccode\u003etf.saved_model\u003c/code\u003e\nsubmodules to \u003ccode\u003etf.saved_model\u003c/code\u003e module. New endpoints are added in V1 and\nV2 but existing endpoint removals are only applied in V2.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecates behavior where device assignment overrides collocation\nconstraints inside a collocation context manager.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras \u0026amp; Python API\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd to Keras functionality analogous to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.register_tensor_conversion_function\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSubclassed Keras models can now be saved through\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.saved_model.save_keras_model\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLinearOperator.matmul\u003c/code\u003e now returns a new \u003ccode\u003eLinearOperator\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew ops and improved op functionality\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a Nearest Neighbor Resize op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd an \u003ccode\u003eignore_unknown\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003eparse_values\u003c/code\u003e which suppresses\nValueError for unknown hyperparameter types. Such * Add\n\u003ccode\u003etf.linalg.matvec\u003c/code\u003e convenience function.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.einsum()\u003c/code\u003eraises \u003ccode\u003eValueError\u003c/code\u003e for unsupported equations like\n\u003ccode\u003e\"ii-\u0026gt;\"\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd DCT-I and IDCT-I in \u003ccode\u003etf.signal.dct\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.signal.idct\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd LU decomposition op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd quantile loss to gradient boosted trees in estimator.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eround_mode\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eQuantizeAndDequantizeV2\u003c/code\u003e op to select rounding\nalgorithm.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eunicode_encode\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eunicode_decode\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eunicode_decode_with_offsets\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eunicode_split\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eunicode_split_with_offset\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eunicode_transcode\u003c/code\u003e\nops. Amongst other things, this Op adds the ability to encode, decode,\nand transcode a variety of input text encoding formats into the main\nUnicode encodings (UTF-8, UTF-16-BE, UTF-32-BE)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \"unit\" attribute to the substr op, which allows obtaining the\nsubstring of a string containing unicode characters.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBroadcasting support for Ragged Tensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSpaceToDepth\u003c/code\u003e supports uint8 data type.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport multi-label quantile regression in estimator.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWe now use \"div\" as the default partition_strategy in\n\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.safe_embedding_lookup_sparse\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.sampled_softmax\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.nce_loss\u003c/code\u003e. hyperparameter are ignored.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove performance of GPU cumsum/cumprod by up to 300x.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for weight decay in most TPU embedding optimizers,\nincluding AdamW and MomentumW.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow 2.0 Development\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a command line tool to convert to TF2.0, tf_upgrade_v2\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMerge \u003ccode\u003etf.spectral\u003c/code\u003e into \u003ccode\u003etf.signal\u003c/code\u003e for TensorFlow 2.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChange the default recurrent activation function for LSTM from\n'hard_sigmoid' to 'sigmoid' in 2.0. Historically recurrent activation is\n'hard_sigmoid' since it is fast than 'sigmoid'. With new unified backend\nbetween CPU and GPU mode, since the CuDNN kernel is using sigmoid, we\nchange the default for CPU mode to sigmoid as well. With that, the\ndefault LSTM will be compatible with both CPU and GPU kernel. This will\nenable user with GPU to use CuDNN kernel by default and get a 10x\nperformance boost in training. Note that this is checkpoint breaking\nchange. If user want to use their 1.x pre-trained checkpoint, please\nconstruct the layer with LSTM(recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid') to\nfallback to 1.x behavior.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow Lite\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove from \u003ccode\u003etensorflow/contrib/lite\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003etensorflow/lite\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd experimental Java API for injecting TensorFlow Lite delegates\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for strings in TensorFlow Lite Java API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd Apache Ignite Filesystem plugin to support accessing Apache IGFS.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDropout now takes \u003ccode\u003erate\u003c/code\u003e argument, \u003ccode\u003ekeep_prob\u003c/code\u003e is to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.BaselineEstimator\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.BaselineEstimator\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.DNNLinearCombinedEstimator\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.DNNLinearCombinedEstimator\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.DNNEstimator\u003c/code\u003e with \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.DNNEstimator\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.LinearEstimator\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.LinearEstimator\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.InMemoryEvaluatorHook\u003c/code\u003e and\ntf.estimator.experimental.InMemoryEvaluatorHook`.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.make_stop_at_checkpoint_step_hook\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.experimental.make_stop_at_checkpoint_step_hook\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpose `tf.distribute.Strategy as the new name for\ntf.contrib.distribute.DistributionStrategy.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMigrate linear optimizer from contrib to core.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.signal\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003etf.signal\u003c/code\u003e (preserving aliases in\ntf.contrib.signal).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUsers of \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.estimator.export_all_saved_models\u003c/code\u003e and related\nshould switch to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.Estimator.experimental_export_all_saved_models\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.data:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.StatsOptions()\u003c/code\u003e, to configure options to\ncollect statistics from \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e pipeline using\n\u003ccode\u003eStatsAggregator\u003c/code\u003e. Add nested option, \u003ccode\u003eexperimental_stats\u003c/code\u003e (which takes\na \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimen tal.StatsOptions\u003c/code\u003e object), to \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Options\u003c/code\u003e.\nDeprecates \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.set_stats_agregator\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance optimizations:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.OptimizationOptions()\u003c/code\u003e, to configure options\nto enable \u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e performance optimizations. Add nested option,\n\u003ccode\u003eexperimental_optimization\u003c/code\u003e (which takes a\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.OptimizationOptions\u003c/code\u003e object), to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Options\u003c/code\u003e. Remove performance optimization options from\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Options\u003c/code\u003e, and add them under\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.OptimizationOptions\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable \u003ccode\u003emap_and_batch_fusion\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003enoop_elimination\u003c/code\u003e optimizations by\ndefault. They can be disabled by configuring\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.experimental.OptimizationOptions\u003c/code\u003e to set \u003ccode\u003emap_and_batch = False\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003enoop_elimination = False\u003c/code\u003e respectively. To disable all\ndefault optimizations, set \u003ccode\u003eapply_default_optimizations = False\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport parallel map in \u003ccode\u003emap_and_filter_fusion\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDisable static optimizations for input pipelines that use non-resource\n\u003ccode\u003etf.Variable\u003c/code\u003es.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd NUMA-aware MapAndBatch dataset.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.make_one_shot_iterator()\u003c/code\u003e in V1, removed it\nfrom V2, and added tf.compat.v1.data.make_one_shot_iterator()`.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.make_initializable_iterator()\u003c/code\u003e in V1, removed\nit from V2, and added \u003ccode\u003etf.compat.v1.data.make_initializable_iterator()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable nested dataset support in core \u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e transformations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFor \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e implementers: Added\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset._element_structured property\u003c/code\u003e to replace\n\u003ccode\u003eDataset.output_{types,shapes,classes}\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake \u003ccode\u003enum_parallel_calls\u003c/code\u003e of \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.interleave\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.map\u003c/code\u003e work in Eager mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eToolchains\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed OpenSSL compatibility by avoiding \u003ccode\u003eEVP_MD_CTX_destroy\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded bounds checking to printing deprecation warnings.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpgraded CUDA dependency to any calls to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.get_signature_def_by_key(metagraph_def, signature_def_key)\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003emeta_graph_def.signature_def[signature_def_key]\u003c/code\u003e. Catching a ValueError\nexception thrown by \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.get_signature_def_by_key\u003c/code\u003e should be\nreplaced by catching a KeyError exception.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate, and replace by tf.data.experimental.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eInstead of jemalloc, revert back to using system malloc since it\nsimplifies build and has comparable performance.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove integer types from \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.softplus\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.softsign\u003c/code\u003e OpDefs.\nThis is a bugfix; these ops were never meant to support integers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow subslicing Tensors with a single dimension.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd option to calculate string length in Unicode characters.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd functionality to SubSlice a tensor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd searchsorted (ie lower/upper_bound) op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd model explainability to Boosted Trees.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport negative positions for tf.substr.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThere was previously a bug in the bijector_impl where the\n_reduce_jacobian_det_over_event does not handle scalar ILDJ\nimplementations properly.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn tf eager execution, allow re-entering a GradientTape context.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd tf_api_version flag. If --define=tf_api_version=2 flag is passed in,\nthen bazel will build TensorFlow API version 2.0. Note that TensorFlow\n2.0 is under active development and has no guarantees at this point.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd additional compression options to TfRecordWriter.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance improvements for regex full match operations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReplace tf.GraphKeys.VARIABLES with \u003ccode\u003etf.GraphKeys.GLOBAL_VARIABLES\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove unused dynamic learning rate support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-20\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" See updated install guides:\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux#tensorflow_gpu_support\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eInstalling TensorFlow on Ubuntu\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoogle Cloud TPU:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental tf.data integration for Keras on Google Cloud TPUs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExperimental / preview support for eager execution on Google Cloud TPUs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDistributionStrategy:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd multi-GPU DistributionStrategy support in tf.keras. Users can now\nuse \u003ccode\u003efit\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eevaluate\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003epredict\u003c/code\u003e to distribute their model on\nmultiple GPUs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd multi-worker DistributionStrategy and standalone client support in\nEstimator. details.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd C, C++, and Python functions for querying kernels.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\"
