dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanged the signature of SessionFactory::NewSession so that it can\nreturn a meaningful error message on failure.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.data:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove \u003ccode\u003enum_parallel_parser_calls\u003c/code\u003e argument from\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.make_csv_dataset()\u003c/code\u003e. [tf.data] Remove\n\u003ccode\u003enum_parallel_parser_calls\u003c/code\u003e argument from\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.make_csv_dataset()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.list_files()\u003c/code\u003e raises an exception at initialization\ntime if the argument matches no files.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRenamed BigTable class to BigtableTable for clarity\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDocument use of the Cloud Bigtable API\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.reduce_dataset\u003c/code\u003e which can be used to reduce a\ndataset to a single element.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGeneralization of \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.sliding_window_batch\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eINC:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRuntime improvements to triangular solve.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd an \u003ccode\u003eimplementation\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.LocallyConnected2D\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.layers.LocallyConnected1D\u003c/code\u003e. The new mode\n(\u003ccode\u003eimplementation=2\u003c/code\u003e) performs forward pass as a single dense matrix\nmultiplication, allowing dramatic speedups in certain scenarios (but\nworse performance in others - see docstring). The option also allows to\nuse \u003ccode\u003epadding=same\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd documentation clarifying the differences between tf.fill and\ntf.constant.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd experimental IndexedDatasets.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd selective registration target using the lite proto runtime.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd simple Tensor and DataType classes to TensorFlow Lite Java\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for bitcasting to/from uint32 and uint64.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a subclass of Estimator that can be created from a SavedModel\n(SavedModelEstimator).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds leaf index modes as an argument.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow a different output shape from the input in\ntf.contrib.image.transform.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChange the state_size order of the StackedRNNCell to be natural order.\nTo keep the existing behavior, user can add reverse_state_order=True\nwhen constructing the StackedRNNCells.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate self.test_session() in favor of self.session() or\nself.cached_session().\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDirectly import tensor.proto.h (the transitive import will be removed\nfrom tensor.h soon).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEstimator.train() now supports tf.contrib.summary.* summaries out of\nthe box; each call to .train() will now create a separate tfevents file\nrather than re-using a shared one.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix FTRL L2-shrinkage behavior: the gradient from the L2 shrinkage term\nshould not end up in the accumulator.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix toco compilation/execution on Windows.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoogleZoneProvider class added to detect which Google Cloud Engine zone\ntensorflow is running in.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt is now safe to call any of the C API's TF_Delete* functions on\nnullptr.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLog some errors on Android to logcat.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMatch FakeQuant numerics in TFLite to improve accuracy of TFLite\nquantized inference models.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOptional bucket location check for the GCS Filesystem.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance enhancements for StringSplitOp \u0026amp; StringSplitV2Op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance improvements for regex replace operations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTFRecordWriter now raises an error if .write() fails.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTPU: More helpful error messages in TPUClusterResolvers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe legacy_init_op argument to SavedModelBuilder methods for adding\nMetaGraphs has been deprecated. Please use the equivalent main_op\nargument instead. As part of this, we now explicitly check for a single\nmain_op or legacy_init_op at the time of SavedModel building, whereas\nthe check on main_op was previously only done at load time.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe protocol used for Estimator training is now configurable in\nRunConfig.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTriangular solve performance improvements.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUnify RNN cell interface between TF and Keras. Add new\nget_initial_state() to Keras and TF RNN cell, which will use to replace\nthe existing zero_state() method.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate initialization of variables in Keras.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates to \"constrained_optimization\" in tensorflow/contrib.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eboosted trees: adding pruning mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.train.Checkpoint does not delete old checkpoints by default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etfdbg: Limit the total disk space occupied by dumped tensor data to 100\nGBytes. Add environment variable \u003ccode\u003eTFDBG_DISK_BYTES_LIMIT\u003c/code\u003e to allow\nadjustment of this upper limit.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-21\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#thanks-to-our-contributors-21\"\u003eThanks to our Contributors\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis release contains contributions from many people at Google, as well as:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAapeli, adoda, Ag Ramesh, Amogh Mannekote, Andrew Gibiansky, Andy Craze, Anirudh\nKoul, Aurelien Geron, Avijit, Avijit-Nervana, Ben, Benjamin H. \u003ccode\u003ecomplex64\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eInitial\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/r1.10/tensorflow/contrib/bigtable\"\u003eGoogle Cloud Bigtable integration\u003c/a\u003e\nfor \u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved local run behavior in \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.train_and_evaluate\u003c/code\u003e which does\nnot reload checkpoints for evaluation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eRunConfig\u003c/code\u003e now sets device_filters to restrict how workers and PS can\ncommunicate. This can speed up training and ensure clean shutdowns in some\nsituations. But if you have jobs that require communication between workers,\nyou will have to set custom session_options in your \u003ccode\u003eRunConfig\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMoved Distributions and Bijectors from \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/probability\"\u003eTensorflow Probability (TFP)\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions\u003c/code\u003e is now deprecated and will be removed by the end\nof 2018.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding new endpoints for existing tensorflow symbols. dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.group_by_reducer()\u003c/code\u003e is now available via the public\nAPI.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.choose_from_datasets()\u003c/code\u003e is now available via the public\nAPI.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding \u003ccode\u003edrop_remainder\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.batch()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset.padded_batch()\u003c/code\u003e, deprecating\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.padded_batch_and_drop_remainder()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEstimator\u003c/code\u003es now use custom savers included in \u003ccode\u003eEstimatorSpec\u003c/code\u003e scaffolds\nfor saving SavedModels during export.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEstimatorSpec\u003c/code\u003e will now add a default prediction output for export if\nno \u003ccode\u003eexport_output\u003c/code\u003e is provided, eliminating the need to explicitly\ninclude a \u003ccode\u003ePredictOutput\u003c/code\u003e object in the \u003ccode\u003emodel_fn\u003c/code\u003e for simple use-cases.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport sparse_combiner in canned Linear Estimators.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded batch normalization to \u003ccode\u003eDNNClassifier\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eDNNRegressor\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003eDNNEstimator\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding ranking support for boosted trees.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding center bias option for boosted trees.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003esynchronization\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eaggregation\u003c/code\u003e args to get_variable(). These args\nwill be used for distributed variables.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003esynchronization\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eaggregation\u003c/code\u003e args to the layer \u003ccode\u003eadd_weight()\u003c/code\u003e\nAPI. These args will be used for distributed variables.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.losses.*\u003c/code\u003e do not add to the global collection when executing eagerly (to\navoid leaking memory).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport different summary and checkpoint directories in\n\u003ccode\u003etf.train.MonitoredTrainingSession()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded IndRNN, IndyGRU, and IndyLSTM cells to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.rnn\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd safe static factory functions for SparseTensor and convert all CHECKs to\nDCHECKs. Using the constructor directly is unsafe and deprecated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake the Bigtable client connection pool configurable \u0026amp; increase the\ndefault # of connections for performance.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded derivative of \u003ccode\u003etf.random_gamma\u003c/code\u003e with respect to the alpha parameter.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded derivative of \u003ccode\u003etf.igamma(a, x)\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.igammac(a, x)\u003c/code\u003e with respect to\na.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eModified Bessel functions of order zero and one.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd FillTriangular Bijector to create triangular matrices.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for Type III DCT, and \u003ccode\u003etf.spectral.idct(type=2|3)\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCorrectly handle CuDNN RNN weight loaded when nest in \u003ccode\u003eTimeDistributed\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding per-element weight support for \u003ccode\u003eWALSComputePartialLhsAndRhsOp\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eZerosLike and OnesLike ops treated as constants by Graph Transform Tool.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGamma distribution and the derived distributions (Beta, Dirichlet, Student's\nt, inverse Gamma) now fully reparameterized.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eJava: Experimental wrapper classes to make graph generation easier. Thanks\n@karllessard and @kbsriram\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBuild \u0026amp; link in secure gRPC components (switch from the insecure grpc\ndependency to secure grpc dependency).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding new endpoints for existing tensorflow symbols. These endpoints are\ngoing to be the preferred endpoints going forward and may replace some of\nthe existing endpoints in the future. List of new endpoints:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew endpoints in \u003ccode\u003etf.image\u003c/code\u003e namespace: \u003ccode\u003etf.image.extract_image_patches\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew endpoints in \u003ccode\u003etf.debugging\u003c/code\u003e namespace:\n\u003ccode\u003etf.debugging.check_numerics\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.debugging.is_finite\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.debugging.is_inf\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.debugging.is_nan\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew endpoints in \u003ccode\u003etf.dtypes\u003c/code\u003e namespace: \u003ccode\u003etf.dtypes.as_string\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew endpoints in \u003ccode\u003etf.io\u003c/code\u003e namespace: \u003ccode\u003etf.io.decode_base64\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.io.decode_compressed\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.io.decode_json_example\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.io.decode_raw\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.io.encode_base64\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.io.matching_files\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.io.parse_tensor\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.io.read_file,\u003c/code\u003etf.io.write_file`.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew endpoints in tf.linalg namespace: \u003ccode\u003etf.linalg.cross\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.linalg.tensor_diag\u003c/code\u003e (corresponds to \u003ccode\u003etf.diag\u003c/code\u003e),\n\u003ccode\u003etf.linalg.tensor_diag_part\u003c/code\u003e (corresponds to \u003ccode\u003etf.diag_part\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew endpoints in tf.manip namespace: \u003ccode\u003etf.manip.batch_to_space_nd\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.manip.gather_nd\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.manip.reshape\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.manip.reverse\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.manip.scatter_nd\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.manip.space_to_batch_nd\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eseed\u003c/code\u003e is passed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.sample_from_datasets()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.choose_from_datasets()\u003c/code\u003e make it easier to sample or\ndeterministically choose elements from multiple datasets.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.make_csv_dataset()\u003c/code\u003e now supports line breaks in quoted\nstrings, and two infrequently used arguments removed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e(C++) \u003ccode\u003eDatasetBase::DebugString()\u003c/code\u003e is now \u003ccode\u003econst\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e(C++) \u003ccode\u003eDatasetBase::MakeIterator()\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to\n\u003ccode\u003eDatasetBase::MakeIteratorInternal()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e(C++) \u003ccode\u003eIteratorBase::Initialize()\u003c/code\u003e method was added to support raising\nerrors during iterator construction.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEager Execution:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded the ability to pause recording operations for gradient computation\nvia \u003ccode\u003etf.GradientTape.stop_recording\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdated documentation, introductory notebooks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove Keras code out of _impl folder and remove API files.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras.Model.save_weights\u003c/code\u003e now saves in TensorFlow format by default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable dataset iterators to be passed to \u003ccode\u003etf.keras.Model\u003c/code\u003e training/eval\nmethods.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow Debugger (tfdbg) CLI: fix an issue in which the TensorBoard\nDebugger Plugin could not handle total source file size exceeding gRPC\nmessage size limit (4 MB).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.framework.zero_initializer\u003c/code\u003e supports ResourceVariable.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding \"constrained_optimization\" to tensorflow/contrib.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd GCS Configuration Ops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanging signature of \u003ccode\u003eMakeIterator\u003c/code\u003e to enable propagating error status.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKL divergence for two Dirichlet distributions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMore consistent GcsFileSystem behavior for certain reads past EOF.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate benchmark for tf.scan to match ranges across eager and graph\nmodes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed bug in \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_prod gradient\u003c/code\u003e for complex dtypes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow the use of '.' in variables (e.g. \"hparams.parse('a.b=1.0')\"),\nwhich would previously raise an error. This will correspond to an\nattribute name with an embedded '.' symbol (e.g. 'a.b'), which can only\nbe accessed indirectly (e.g. through getattr and setattr). To set this\nup the user will first need to explicitly add the variable to the hparam\nobject (e.g. \"hparams.add_hparam(name='a.b', value=0.0)\").\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBenchmark for tf.scan in graph and eager modes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded complex128 support to FFT, FFT2D, FFT3D, IFFT, IFFT2D, and IFFT3D.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMaking ids unique in \u003ccode\u003enn.embedding_lookup_sparse\u003c/code\u003e. This helps to reduce\nRPC calls for looking up the embeddings when there are repeated ids in\nthe batch.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport indicator column in boosted trees.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePrevent \u003ccode\u003etf.gradients()\u003c/code\u003e from backpropagating through integer tensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLinearOperator[1D,2D,3D]Circulant added to \u003ccode\u003etensorflow.linalg\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConv3D, Conv3DBackpropInput, Conv3DBackpropFilter now supports\narbitrary.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.train.Checkpoint\u003c/code\u003e for reading/writing object-based\ncheckpoints.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded LinearOperatorKronecker, a dense-free implementation of the\nKronecker Product.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow LinearOperator to broadcast.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSavedModelBuilder will now deduplicate asset names that point to files\nwith the same basename and the same contents. Note that this may result\nin new asset files included in SavedModels in cases where assets with\nthe same name but different contents were previously overwriting each\nother.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-23\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#thanks-to-our-contributors-23\"\u003eThanks to our Contributors\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis release contains contributions from many people at Google, as well as:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAbdullah Alrasheed, Achal Shah, Ad-530, ADiegoCAlonso, Aditya Yogi, Ag Ramesh,\nakindyakov, Andy Kernahan, Anya Petrova, Aurelien Geron, Ben, Ben Barsdell,\nBhavani-Subramanian, braincodercn, Brett Koonce, Brian Nemsick, Brian Zier,\nBryan Heden, candy.dc, cclauss, Clayne Robison, ctiijima, Dalmo Cirne, David\nNorman, David T.H. \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distribute.MirroredStrategy()\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.RunConfig()\u003c/code\u003e to run an Estimator model on multiple GPUs on performance\nand usability.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow\u003c/code\u003e is moving out to it's own repo.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.{proto,rpc}\u003c/code\u003e to allow generic proto parsing and RPC\ncommunication\u003csup\u003e\u003ca dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.prefetch_to_device\u003c/code\u003e, which enables prefetching\ndataset elements to GPU memory.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.AUTOTUNE\u003c/code\u003e, which allows the tf.data runtime to\nautomatically tune the prefetch buffer sizes based on your system and\nenvironment.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.make_csv_dataset\u003c/code\u003e for building datasets of CSV\nfiles.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEager Execution:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWith eager execution Datasets can now be used as standard python\niterators (\u003ccode\u003efor batch in dataset:\u003c/code\u003e). Both \u003ccode\u003eDataset.__iter__()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eDataset.make_one_shot_iterator()\u003c/code\u003e can now be used to create iterators\nwhen eager execution is enabled.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutomatic device placement has been enabled (i.e., use a GPU if\navailable automatically, without requiring an explicit \u003ccode\u003ewith tf.device(“/gpu:0”)\u003c/code\u003e) (Fixes #14133)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.GradientTape\u003c/code\u003e has moved out of contrib.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded the fashion mnist dataset.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew data preprocessing functions: \u003ccode\u003eimage/random_brightness\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003esequence/TimeseriesGenerator\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003etext/hashing_trick\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAccelerated Linear Algebra (XLA):\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSelect and scatter in reference util and evaluator now use\nlexicographical order to break ties.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow Debugger (tfdbg) CLI:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDuring tensor-filter operations, allow exclusion of nodes by regular\nexpressions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix spurious background colors in some text terminals.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd meta-distribution BatchReshape which reshapes batch dimensions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.layers.recompute_grad\u003c/code\u003e works for explicit gradient\ncheckpointing on TPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.framework.argsort\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow \u003ccode\u003eDNNBoostedTreeCombinedEstimator\u003c/code\u003e to work with core versions of\nfeature columns and losses.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd non-linear image warping ops: \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.image.sparse_image_warp\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.image.dense_image_warp\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.image.interpolate_spline\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix bug in \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.opt.MultitaskOptimizerWrapper\u003c/code\u003e where types of\ntensors were mismatched.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLow-level graph construction now calls the TensorFlow C API. This change\nshould be invisible to most users, but can be disabled by setting the\nenvironment variable \u003ccode\u003eTF_C_API_GRAPH_CONSTRUCTION=0\u003c/code\u003e in this release.\nFuture releases will remove the ability to disable this change. Please\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/new\"\u003efile a bug\u003c/a\u003e if you\nfind yourself using this escape hatch.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd description of shapes and a pointer to tutorial notebook in\n\u003ccode\u003etf.distributions.Distribution\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate scatter operations:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.scatter_min\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.scatter_max\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtend scatter operations to work with a scalar update parameter.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove cuDNN RNN ops to core for use in TensorFlow codebase only.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003efloat64\u003c/code\u003e support for \u003ccode\u003eConv2d\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eConv2dBackpropInput\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003eConv2dBackpropFilter\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003efloat64\u003c/code\u003e support for \u003ccode\u003eAvgPool\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003eAvgPoolGrad\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake graph name scope thread local so that they work correctly in\nmulti-threaded environments.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate nsync synchronization library to avoid slow primitives on Linux.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved need to put nsync/public on C include path when building custom\nops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.image.psnr\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.image.ssim\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.image.ssim_multiscale\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.image.image_gradients\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.image.sobel_edges\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd links to \u003ca href=\"https://js.tensorflow.org\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://js.tensorflow.org\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix non-uniformity of orthogonal matrices.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix bug where multi-image Estimator eval summaries were not displayed\ncorrectly.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca name=\"user-content-rpc-issue\"\u003e\u003csup\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/a\u003e The cancellation logic of the RPC op\ncontains a concurrency error. dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eMaxPoolGradGrad\u003c/code\u003e support for XLA\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCSE pass from Tensorflow is now disabled in XLA.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for building C++ Dataset op kernels as external libraries,\nusing the \u003ccode\u003etf.load_op_library()\u003c/code\u003e mechanism.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDataset.list_files()\u003c/code\u003e now shuffles its output by default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDataset.shuffle(..., seed=tf.constant(0, dtype=tf.int64))\u003c/code\u003e now yields\nthe same sequence of elements as \u003ccode\u003eDataset.shuffle(..., seed=0)\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003enum_parallel_reads\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003etf.data.TFRecordDataset\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow.halton_sequence\u003c/code\u003e now supports randomization.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for scalars in \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.all_reduce\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eeffective_sample_size\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow.mcmc_diagnostics\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003epotential_scale_reduction\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow.mcmc_diagnostics\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eBatchNormalization\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eKumaraswamy\u003c/code\u003e bijectors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.learn\u003c/code\u003e. Please check contrib/learn/README.md for\ninstructions on how to convert existing code.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove deprecated \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.Iterator\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.FixedLengthRecordDataset\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.TextLineDataset\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.TFRecordDataset\u003c/code\u003e\nclasses.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ebucket_by_sequence_length\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003esliding_window_batch\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003emake_batched_features_dataset\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove unmaintained \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.ndlstm\u003c/code\u003e. You can find it externally at\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tmbarchive/tfndlstm\"\u003ehttps://github.com/tmbarchive/tfndlstm\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMoved most of \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow\u003c/code\u003e to its own repo: \u003ccode\u003etfp\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etf.py_func now reports the full stack trace if an exception occurs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntegrate \u003ccode\u003eTPUClusterResolver\u003c/code\u003e with GKE's integration for Cloud TPUs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a library for statistical testing of samplers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd Helpers to stream data from the GCE VM to a Cloud TPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntegrate ClusterResolvers with TPUEstimator.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUnify metropolis_hastings interface with HMC kernel.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove LIBXSMM convolutions to a separate --define flag so that they are\ndisabled by default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003eMomentumOptimizer\u003c/code\u003e lambda.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReduce \u003ccode\u003etfp.layers\u003c/code\u003e boilerplate via programmable docstrings.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eauc_with_confidence_intervals\u003c/code\u003e, a method for computing the AUC and\nconfidence interval with linearithmic time complexity.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eregression_head\u003c/code\u003e now accepts customized link function, to satisfy the\nusage that user can define their own link function if the\n\u003ccode\u003earray_ops.identity\u003c/code\u003e does not meet the requirement.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003einitialized_value\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003einitial_value\u003c/code\u003e behaviors for\n\u003ccode\u003eResourceVariables\u003c/code\u003e created from \u003ccode\u003eVariableDef\u003c/code\u003e protos.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd TensorSpec to represent the specification of Tensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConstant folding pass is now deterministic.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport \u003ccode\u003efloat16\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003edtype\u003c/code\u003e in \u003ccode\u003etf.linalg.*\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.export.TensorServingInputReceiver\u003c/code\u003e that allows\n\u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.Estimator.export_savedmodel\u003c/code\u003e to pass raw tensors to model\nfunctions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsing XLA:GPU with CUDA 9 and CUDA 9.1 results in garbage results and/or\n\u003ccode\u003eCUDA_ILLEGAL_ADDRESS\u003c/code\u003e failures.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eGoogle discovered in mid-December 2017 that the PTX-to-SASS compiler in CUDA\n9 and CUDA 9.1 sometimes does not properly compute the carry bit when\ndecomposing 64-bit address calculations with large offsets (e.g. \u003ccode\u003eload [x + large_constant]\u003c/code\u003e) into 32-bit arithmetic in SASS.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAs a result, these versions of \u003ccode\u003eptxas\u003c/code\u003e miscompile most XLA programs which\nuse more than 4GB of temp memory. This results in garbage results and/or\n\u003ccode\u003eCUDA_ERROR_ILLEGAL_ADDRESS\u003c/code\u003e failures.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA fix in CUDA 9.1.121 is expected in late February 2018. We do not expect a\nfix for CUDA 9.0.x. Until the fix is available, the only workaround is to\n\u003ca href=\"https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit-archive\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003edowngrade\u003c/a\u003e to CUDA 8.0.x\nor disable XLA:GPU.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensorFlow will print a warning if you use XLA:GPU with a known-bad version\nof CUDA; see e00ba24c4038e7644da417ddc639169b6ea59122.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-26\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions.Autoregressive\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions\u003c/code\u003e QuadratureCompound classes added to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow.layers\u003c/code\u003e, a collection of that you can only install TensorFlow on 64-bit machines.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a short doc explaining how \u003ccode\u003eEstimator\u003c/code\u003es save checkpoints.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd documentation for ops supported by the \u003ccode\u003etf2xla\u003c/code\u003e bridge.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix minor typos in the doc of \u003ccode\u003eSpaceToDepth\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eDepthToSpace\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdated documentation comments in \u003ccode\u003emfcc_mel_filterbank.h\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003emfcc.h\u003c/code\u003e\nto clarify that the input domain is squared magnitude spectra and the\nweighting is done on linear magnitude spectra (sqrt of inputs).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChange \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions\u003c/code\u003e docstring examples to use \u003ccode\u003etfd\u003c/code\u003e alias\nrather than \u003ccode\u003eds\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ebs\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix docstring typos in \u003ccode\u003etf.distributions.bijectors.Bijector\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.assert_equal\u003c/code\u003e no longer raises \u003ccode\u003eValueError.\u003c/code\u003e It now raises\n\u003ccode\u003eInvalidArgumentError,\u003c/code\u003e as documented.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate Getting Started docs and API intro.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoogle Cloud Storage (GCS):\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd userspace DNS caching for the GCS client.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCustomize request timeouts for the GCS filesystem.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove GCS filesystem caching.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBug Fixes:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix bug where partitioned integer variables got their wrong shapes.\nBefore\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix correctness bug in CPU and GPU implementations of Adadelta.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix a bug in \u003ccode\u003eimport_meta_graph\u003c/code\u003e's handling of partitioned variables\nwhen importing into a scope. WARNING: This may break loading checkpoints\nof graphs with partitioned variables saved after using\n\u003ccode\u003eimport_meta_graph\u003c/code\u003e with a non-empty \u003ccode\u003eimport_scope\u003c/code\u003e argument.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix bug in offline debugger which prevented viewing events.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded the \u003ccode\u003eWorkerService.DeleteWorkerSession\u003c/code\u003e method to the gRPC\ninterface, to fix a memory leak. Ensure that your master and worker\nservers are running the same version of TensorFlow to avoid\ncompatibility issues.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix bug in peephole implementation of BlockLSTM cell.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix bug by casting dtype of \u003ccode\u003elog_det_jacobian\u003c/code\u003e to match \u003ccode\u003elog_prob\u003c/code\u003e in\n\u003ccode\u003eTransformedDistribution\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix a bug in \u003ccode\u003eimport_meta_graph\u003c/code\u003e's handling of partitioned variables\nwhen\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnsure \u003ccode\u003etf.distributions.Multinomial\u003c/code\u003e doesn't underflow in \u003ccode\u003elog_prob\u003c/code\u003e.\nBefore this change, all partitions of an integer variable were\ninitialized with the shape of the unpartitioned variable; after this\nchange they are initialized correctly.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd necessary shape util support for bfloat16.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a way to run ops using a step function to MonitoredSession.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eDenseFlipout\u003c/code\u003e probabilistic layer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA new flag \u003ccode\u003eignore_live_threads\u003c/code\u003e is available on train. If set to\n\u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e, it will ignore threads that remain running when tearing down\ninfrastructure after successfully completing training, instead of\nthrowing a RuntimeError.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRestandardize \u003ccode\u003eDenseVariational\u003c/code\u003e as simpler template for other\nprobabilistic layers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e now supports \u003ccode\u003etf.SparseTensor\u003c/code\u003e components in dataset elements.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt is now possible to iterate over \u003ccode\u003eTensor\u003c/code\u003es.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow \u003ccode\u003eSparseSegmentReduction\u003c/code\u003e ops to have missing segment IDs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eModify custom export strategy to account for multidimensional sparse\nfloat splits.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eConv2D\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eConv2DBackpropInput\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eConv2DBackpropFilter\u003c/code\u003e now supports\narbitrary dilations with GPU and cuDNNv6 support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEstimator\u003c/code\u003e now supports \u003ccode\u003eDataset\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003einput_fn\u003c/code\u003e can return a \u003ccode\u003eDataset\u003c/code\u003e\ninstead of \u003ccode\u003eTensor\u003c/code\u003es.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eRevBlock\u003c/code\u003e, a memory-efficient implementation of reversible residual\nlayers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReduce BFCAllocator internal fragmentation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003ecross_entropy\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ekl_divergence\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.distributions.Distribution\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits_v2\u003c/code\u003e which enables backprop\nw.r.t. the labels.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGPU back-end now uses \u003ccode\u003eptxas\u003c/code\u003e to compile generated PTX.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBufferAssignment\u003c/code\u003e's protocol buffer dump is now deterministic.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChange embedding op to use parallel version of \u003ccode\u003eDynamicStitch\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for sparse multidimensional feature columns.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSpeed up the case for sparse float columns that have only 1 value.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow sparse float splits to support multivalent feature columns.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003equantile\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003etf.distributions.TransformedDistribution\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eNCHW_VECT_C\u003c/code\u003e support for \u003ccode\u003etf.depth_to_space\u003c/code\u003e on GPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eNCHW_VECT_C\u003c/code\u003e support for \u003ccode\u003etf.space_to_depth\u003c/code\u003e on GPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-api-changes-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsing XLA:GPU with CUDA 9 and CUDA 9.1 results in garbage results and/or\n\u003ccode\u003eCUDA_ILLEGAL_ADDRESS\u003c/code\u003e failures.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eGoogle discovered in mid-December 2017 that the PTX-to-SASS compiler in CUDA\n9 and CUDA 9.1 sometimes does not properly compute the carry bit when\ndecomposing 64-bit address calculations with large offsets (e.g. \u003ccode\u003eload [x + large_constant]\u003c/code\u003e) into 32-bit arithmetic in SASS.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAs a result, these versions of \u003ccode\u003eptxas\u003c/code\u003e miscompile most XLA programs which\nuse more than 4GB of temp memory. This results in garbage results and/or\n\u003ccode\u003eCUDA_ERROR_ILLEGAL_ADDRESS\u003c/code\u003e failures.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA fix in CUDA 9.1.121 is expected in late February 2018. We do not expect a\nfix for CUDA 9.0.x. Until the fix is available, the only workaround is to\n\u003ca href=\"https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit-archive\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003edowngrade\u003c/a\u003e to CUDA 8.0.x\nor disable XLA:GPU.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensorFlow will print a warning if you use XLA:GPU with a known-bad version\nof CUDA; see e00ba24c4038e7644da417ddc639169b6ea59122.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-27\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.keras\u003c/code\u003e is now part of the core TensorFlow API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://tensorflow.org/guide/data\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.data\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e is now part of the core\nTensorFlow API.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe API is now subject to backwards compatibility guarantees.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFor a guide to migrating from the \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data\u003c/code\u003e API, see the\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.4/tensorflow/contrib/data/README.md\"\u003eREADME\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMajor new features include \u003ccode\u003eDataset.from_generator()\u003c/code\u003e (for building an\ninput pipeline from a Python generator), and the \u003ccode\u003eDataset.apply()\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod for applying custom transformation functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSeveral custom transformation functions have been added, including\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.sloppy_interleave()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etrain_and_evaluate\u003c/code\u003e for simple distributed \u003ccode\u003eEstimator\u003c/code\u003e training.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.spectral.dct\u003c/code\u003e for computing the DCT-II.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficient support to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.signal\u003c/code\u003e (with\nGPU and gradient support).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a self-check on \u003ccode\u003eimport tensorflow\u003c/code\u003e for Windows DLL issues.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd NCHW support to \u003ccode\u003etf.depth_to_space\u003c/code\u003e on GPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow Debugger (tfdbg):\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eeval\u003c/code\u003e command to allow evaluation of arbitrary Python/numpy\nexpressions in tfdbg command-line interface. See\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/debugger\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eDebugging TensorFlow Programs\u003c/a\u003e\nfor more details.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUsability improvement: The frequently used tensor filter\n\u003ccode\u003ehas_inf_or_nan\u003c/code\u003e is now added to \u003ccode\u003eSession\u003c/code\u003e wrappers and hooks by\ndefault. So there is no need for clients to call\n\u003ccode\u003e.add_tensor_filter(tf_debug.has_inf_or_nan)\u003c/code\u003e anymore.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSinhArcsinh (scalar) distribution added to \u003ccode\u003econtrib.distributions\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake \u003ccode\u003eGANEstimator\u003c/code\u003e opensource.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEstimator.export_savedmodel()\u003c/code\u003e now includes all valid serving signatures\nthat can be constructed from the Serving Input Receiver and all available\nExportOutputs. For instance, a classifier may provide regression- and\nprediction-flavored outputs, in addition to the classification-flavored one.\nBuilding signatures from these allows TF Serving to honor requests using the\ndifferent APIs (Classify, Regress, and Predict). Furthermore,\n\u003ccode\u003eserving_input_receiver_fn()\u003c/code\u003e may now specify alternative subsets of nodes\nthat may act as inputs. This allows, for instance, producing a prediction\nsignature for a classifier that accepts raw \u003ccode\u003eTensors\u003c/code\u003e instead of a\nserialized \u003ccode\u003etf.Example\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow.hmc\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions.MixtureSameFamily\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake \u003ccode\u003eDataset.shuffle()\u003c/code\u003e always reshuffles after each iteration by default.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.bayesflow.metropolis_hastings\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003elog_rate\u003c/code\u003e parameter to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions.Poisson\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExtend \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions.bijector\u003c/code\u003e API to handle some non-injective\ntransforms.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eJava:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGenerics (e.g., \u003ccode\u003eTensor\u0026lt;Integer\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e) for improved type-safety (courtesy\n@andrewcmyers).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport for multi-dimensional string tensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport loading of custom operations (e.g. many in \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib\u003c/code\u003e) on\nLinux and OS X\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAll our prebuilt binaries have been built with CUDA 8 and cuDNN 6. We\nanticipate releasing TensorFlow 1.5 with CUDA 9 and cuDNN 7.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-bug-fixes-and-other-changes-51\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#bug-fixes-and-other-changes-51\"\u003eBug Fixes and Other Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.rnn_cell.DropoutWrapper\u003c/code\u003e is now more careful about dropping out LSTM\nstates. Specifically, it no longer ever drops the \u003ccode\u003ec\u003c/code\u003e (memory) state of an\n\u003ccode\u003eLSTMStateTuple\u003c/code\u003e. The new behavior leads to proper dropout behavior for\nLSTMs and stacked LSTMs. This bug fix follows recommendations from published\nliterature, but is a behavioral change. State dropout behavior may be\ncustomized via the new \u003ccode\u003edropout_state_filter_visitor\u003c/code\u003e argument.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.training.python_input\u003c/code\u003e. The same behavior, in a more\nflexible and reproducible package, is available via the new\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.Dataset.from_generator\u003c/code\u003e method!\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.distributions.Affine\u003c/code\u003e incorrectly computing\nlog-det-jacobian.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix \u003ccode\u003etf.random_gamma\u003c/code\u003e incorrectly handling non-batch, scalar draws.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eResolved a race condition in TensorForest TreePredictionsV4Op.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoogle Cloud Storage file system, Amazon S3 file system, and Hadoop file\nsystem support are now default build options.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCustom op libraries must link against libtensorflow_framework.so (installed\nat \u003ccode\u003etf.sysconfig.get_lib()\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChange \u003ccode\u003eRunConfig\u003c/code\u003e default behavior to not set a random seed, making random\nbehavior independently random on distributed workers. We expect this to\ngenerally improve training performance. Models that do rely on determinism\nshould set a random seed explicitly.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-to-the-api\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#breaking-changes-to-the-api\"\u003eBreaking Changes to the API\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe signature of the \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.rejection_resample()\u003c/code\u003e function has\nbeen changed. It now returns a function that can be used as an argument to\n\u003ccode\u003eDataset.apply()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.Iterator.from_dataset()\u003c/code\u003e method. Use\n\u003ccode\u003eDataset.make_initializable_iterator()\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove seldom used and unnecessary \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.Iterator.dispose_op()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReorder some TF-GAN loss functions in a non-backwards compatible estimators to Tensorflow library. List of added estimators:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDNNClassifier\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDNNRegressor\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLinearClassifier\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLinearRegressor\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDNNLinearCombinedClassifier\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDNNLinearCombinedRegressor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAll our prebuilt binaries have been built with cuDNN 6. We anticipate\nreleasing TensorFlow 1.4 with cuDNN 7.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eimport tensorflow\u003c/code\u003e now goes much faster.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds a file cache to the GCS filesystem with configurable max staleness for\nfile contents. This permits caching of file contents across close/open\nboundaries.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded an axis parameter to \u003ccode\u003etf.gather\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003econstant_values\u003c/code\u003e keyword argument to \u003ccode\u003etf.pad\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds \u003ccode\u003eDataset.interleave\u003c/code\u003e transformation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003eConcatenateDataset\u003c/code\u003e to concatenate two datasets.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded Mobilenet support to TensorFlow for Poets training script.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds a block cache to the GCS filesystem with configurable block size and\ncount.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSinhArcSinh bijector added.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDataset.list_files\u003c/code\u003e API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduces new operations and Python bindings for the Cloud TPU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding TensorFlow-iOS CocoaPod for symmetry with tensorflow-android.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduces base implementations of ClusterResolvers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUnify memory representations of TensorShape and PartialTensorShape. As a\nconsequence, tensors now have a maximum of 254 dimensions, not 255.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanged references to LIBXSMM to use version 1.8.1.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow Debugger (tfdbg):\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDisplay summaries of numeric tensor values with the \u003ccode\u003e-s\u003c/code\u003e flag to command\n\u003ccode\u003eprint_tensor\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003ept\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDisplay feed values with the \u003ccode\u003eprint_feed\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003epf\u003c/code\u003e command and clickable\nlinks in the curses UI.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRuntime profiler at the op level and the Python source line level with\nthe \u003ccode\u003erun -p\u003c/code\u003e command.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eInitial release of the statistical distribution library \u003ccode\u003etf.distributions\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGPU kernels and speed improvements for unary \u003ccode\u003etf.where\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.top_k\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMonotonic Attention wrappers added to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.seq2seq\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.signal\u003c/code\u003e, a library for signal processing primitives.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.resampler\u003c/code\u003e, containing CPU and GPU ops for differentiable\nresampling of images.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-to-the-api-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" Graph rewriting\nis still available, just not as \u003ccode\u003etf.RewriterConfig\u003c/code\u003e. Instead add an explicit\nimport.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBreaking change to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.data.Dataset\u003c/code\u003e APIs that expect a nested\nstructure. Lists are now converted to \u003ccode\u003etf.Tensor\u003c/code\u003e implicitly. You may need\nto change uses of lists to tuples in existing code. In addition, dicts are\nnow supported as a nested structure.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-changes-to-contrib-apis\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#changes-to-contrib-apis\"\u003eChanges to contrib APIs\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds tf.contrib.nn.rank_sampled_softmax_loss, a sampled-softmax variant that\ncan improve rank loss.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.metrics\u003c/code\u003e.{streaming_covariance,streaming_pearson_correlation}\nmodified to return nan when they have seen less or equal to 1 unit of\nweight.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds time series models to contrib. 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes \u003ccode\u003estrides\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ebegin\u003c/code\u003e dtype mismatch when slicing using int64 Tensor\nindex in python.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved convolution padding documentation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a tag constant, gpu, to present graph with GPU support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003esaved_model.utils\u003c/code\u003e now support SparseTensors transparently.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA more efficient implementation of non-max suppression.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for the shrinkage-type L2 to FtrlOptimizer in addition to the\nonline L2 it already supports.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix negative variance in moments calculation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExpand UniqueOp Benchmark Tests to cover more collision cases.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves stability of GCS filesystem on Mac.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd time estimation to HloCostAnalysis.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed the bug in Estimator that params in constructor was not a deepcopy of\nthe user provided one. This bugs inadvertently enabled user to mutate the\nparams after the creation of Estimator, leading to potentially undefined\nbehavior.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded None check for save_path in \u003ccode\u003esaver.restore\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRegister devices under their legacy names in device_mgr to ease the\ntransition to clusterspec-propagated configurations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVectorExponential added to distributions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a bitwise module with bitwise_and, bitwise_or, bitwise_xor, and invert\nfunctions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd fixed-grid ODE integration routines.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow passing bounds to ScipyOptimizerInterface.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCorrectness fixes for fft_length parameter to \u003ccode\u003etf.spectral.rfft\u003c/code\u003e \u0026amp;\n\u003ccode\u003etf.spectral.irfft\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExported model signatures using the 'predict' method will no longer have\ntheir input and output keys silently ignored and rewritten to 'inputs' and\n'outputs'. If a model was exported with different names before 1.2, and is\nnow served with tensorflow/serving, it will accept requests using 'inputs'\nand 'outputs'. Starting at 1.2, such a model will accept the keys specified\nduring export. Therefore, inference requests using 'inputs' and 'outputs'\nmay start to fail. To fix this, either update any inference clients to send\nrequests with the actual input and output keys used by the trainer code, or\nconversely, update the trainer code to name the input and output Tensors\n'inputs' and 'outputs', respectively. Signatures using the 'classify' and\n'regress' methods are not affected by this change; they will continue to\nstandardize their input and output keys as before.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd in-memory caching to the Dataset API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSet default end_of_sequence variable in datasets iterators to false.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e[Performance] Increase performance of \u003ccode\u003etf.layers.conv2d\u003c/code\u003e when setting\nuse_bias=True by 2x by using nn.bias_add.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate iOS examples to use CocoaPods, and moved to tensorflow/examples/ios.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds a family= attribute in \u003ccode\u003etf.summary\u003c/code\u003e ops to allow controlling the tab\nname used in Tensorboard for organizing summaries.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWhen GPU is configured, do not require --config=cuda, instead, automatically\nbuild for GPU if this is requested in the configure script.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix incorrect sampling of small probabilities in CPU/GPU multinomial.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a list_devices() API on sessions to list devices within a cluster.\nAdditionally, this change augment the ListDevices master API to support\nspecifying a session.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllow uses of over-parameterized separable convolution.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorForest multi-regression bug fix.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFramework now supports armv7, cocoapods.org now displays correct page.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eScript to create iOS framework for CocoaPods.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid releases of TensorFlow are now pushed to jcenter for easier\nintegration into apps. See\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/android/inference_interface/README.md\"\u003ehttps://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/android/inference_interface/README.md\u003c/a\u003e\nfor more details.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow Debugger (tfdbg):\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed a bug that prevented tfdbg from functioning with multi-GPU setups.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed a bug that prevented tfdbg from working with\n\u003ccode\u003etf.Session.make_callable\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" Windows.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.layers.conv3d_transpose\u003c/code\u003e layer for spatio temporal deconvolution.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.Session.make_callable()\u003c/code\u003e, which provides a lower overhead means of\nrunning a similar step multiple times.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded libverbs-based RDMA support to contrib (courtesy @junshi15 from\nYahoo).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBring \u003ccode\u003etf.feature_column.*\u003c/code\u003e into the API. Non-deprecated functionality from\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.layers.*\u003c/code\u003e is moved to \u003ccode\u003etf.feature_column.*\u003c/code\u003e with cosmetic\nchanges.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eRNNCell\u003c/code\u003e objects now subclass \u003ccode\u003etf.layers.Layer\u003c/code\u003e. The strictness described\nin the TensorFlow 1.1 release is gone: The first time an RNNCell is used, it\ncaches its scope. All future uses of the RNNCell will reuse variables from\nthat same scope. This is a breaking change from the behavior of RNNCells in\nTensorFlow versions \u0026lt;= 1.0.1. TensorFlow 1.1 had checks in place to ensure\nold code works correctly with the new semantics; this version allows more\nflexible uses of RNNCell but can lead to subtle errors if using code meant\nfor TensorFlow \u0026lt;= 1.0.1. For example, writing: \u003ccode\u003eMultiRNNCell([lstm] * 5)\u003c/code\u003e\nwill now build a 5-layer LSTM stack where each layer shares the \u003cstrong\u003esame\u003c/strong\u003e\nparameters. To get 5 layers each with their own parameters, write:\n\u003ccode\u003eMultiRNNCell([LSTMCell(...) for _ in range(5)])\u003c/code\u003e. If at all unsure, first\ntest your code with TF 1.1; ensure it raises no errors, and then upgrade to\nTF 1.2.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRNNCells' variable names have been renamed for consistency with Keras\nlayers. Specifically, the previous variable names \"weights\" and \"biases\"\nhave been changed to \"kernel\" and \"bias\", respectively. This may cause\nbackward incompatibility with regard to your old checkpoints containing such\nRNN cells, in which case you can use the tool\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/tools/checkpoint_convert.py\"\u003echeckpoint_convert script\u003c/a\u003e\nto convert the variable names in your old checkpoints.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eMany of the RNN functions and classes that were in the \u003ccode\u003etf.nn\u003c/code\u003e namespace\nbefore the 1.0 release and which were moved to \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.rnn\u003c/code\u003e have now\nbeen moved back to the core namespace. This includes \u003ccode\u003eRNNCell\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eLSTMCell\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eGRUCell\u003c/code\u003e, and a number of other cells. These now reside in \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.rnn_cell\u003c/code\u003e\n(with aliases in \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.rnn\u003c/code\u003e for backwards compatibility). The original\n\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.rnn\u003c/code\u003e function is now \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.static_rnn\u003c/code\u003e, and the bidirectional static\nand state saving static rnn functions are also now back in the \u003ccode\u003etf.nn\u003c/code\u003e\nnamespace.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNotable exceptions are the \u003ccode\u003eEmbeddingWrapper\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eInputProjectionWrapper\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eOutputProjectionWrapper\u003c/code\u003e, which will slowly be moved to deprecation in\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.rnn\u003c/code\u003e. These are inefficient wrappers that should often be\nreplaced by calling \u003ccode\u003eembedding_lookup\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003elayers.dense\u003c/code\u003e as pre- or post-\nprocessing of the rnn. For RNN decoding, this functionality has been\nreplaced with an alternative API in \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.seq2seq\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntel MKL Integration\n(\u003ca href=\"https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/tensorflow-optimizations-on-modern-intel-architecture\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/tensorflow-optimizations-on-modern-intel-architecture\u003c/a\u003e).\nIntel developed a number of optimized deep learning primitives: In addition\nto matrix multiplication and convolution, these building blocks include:\nDirect batched convolution Pooling: maximum, minimum, average Normalization:\nLRN, batch normalization Activation: rectified linear unit (ReLU) Data\nmanipulation: multi-dimensional transposition (conversion), split, concat,\nsum and scale.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensorForest Estimator now supports SavedModel export for serving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSupport client-provided ClusterSpec's and propagate them to all workers to\nenable the creation of dynamic TensorFlow clusters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTensorFlow C library now available for Windows.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe released a new open-source version of TensorBoard.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/guide/saved_model_cli\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSavedModel CLI\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\ntool available to inspect and execute MetaGraph in SavedModel\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAndroid releases of TensorFlow are now pushed to jcenter for easier\nintegration into apps. See\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/android/inference_interface/README.md\"\u003ehttps://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/android/inference_interface/README.md\u003c/a\u003e\nfor more details.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-deprecations-2\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#deprecations-2\"\u003eDeprecations\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow 1.2 may be the last time we build with cuDNN 5.1. consistency\nwith Keras layers. Specifically, the previous variable names \"weights\" and\n\"biases\" are changed to \"kernel\" and \"bias\", respectively. This may cause\nbackward incompatibility with regard to your old checkpoints containing such\nRNN cells, in which case you can use the\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/tools/checkpoint_convert.py\"\u003echeckpoint_convert script\u003c/a\u003e\nto convert the variable names in your old checkpoints.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.kernel_methods\u003c/code\u003e module with Ops and estimators for primal\n(explicit) kernel methods in TensorFlow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-bug-fixes-and-other-changes-54\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#bug-fixes-and-other-changes-54\"\u003eBug Fixes and Other Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn python, \u003ccode\u003eOperation.get_attr\u003c/code\u003e on type attributes returns the Python DType\nversion of the type to match expected get_attr documentation rather than the\nprotobuf enum.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etensorflow/contrib/rnn undergoes RNN cell variable renaming for consistency\nwith Keras layers. Specifically, the previous variable names \"weights\" and\n\"biases\" are changed to \"kernel\" and \"bias\", respectively.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanged MIN_SDK version to 8.0 when building iOS libraries.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed LIBXSMM integration.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake decode_jpeg/decode_png/decode_gif handle all formats, since users\nfrequently try to decode an image as the wrong type.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove implicit broadcasting lowering.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproving stability of GCS/BigQuery clients by a faster retrying of stale\ntransmissions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove OpKernelConstruction::op_def() as part of minimizing proto\ndependencies.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVectorLaplaceDiag distribution added.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid demo no longer requires libtensorflow_demo.so to run\n(libtensorflow_inference.so still required)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ecategorical_column_with_vocabulary_file\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduce ops for batching/unbatching tensors across Session::Run() calls.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd tf.log_sigmoid(x) = tf.log(tf.sigmoid(x)) = -tf.nn.softplus(-x).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanged hooks lists to immutable tuples, and now allow any iterable for the\nassociated arguments.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduce TFDecorator.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded an Mfcc op for speech feature generation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved DirectSession::Run() overhead and error checking. Feeding a value\nof the wrong type will now synchronously raise an INVALID_ARGUMENT error\ninstead of asynchronously raising an INTERNAL error. Code that depends on\nthe (undefined) behavior when feeding a tensor of the wrong type may need to\nbe updated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded unreduced NONE, and reduced MEAN options for losses. Removed\n\"WEIGHTED_\" prefix from other Reduction constants.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eassertAllClose now handles dicts.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded Gmock matcher for HloInstructions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd var name to errors on variable restore.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded an AudioSpectrogram op for audio feature generation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ereduction\u003c/code\u003e arg to losses.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.placeholder\u003c/code\u003e can represent scalar shapes and partially known.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemove estimator_spec(mode) argument.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded an AudioSpectrogram op for audio feature generation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorBoard disables all runs by default if there are more than 40 runs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved old doc generator code.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGCS file system integration now supports domain buckets, e.g\ngs://bucket.domain.com/path.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003etf.summary.text\u003c/code\u003e for outputting text to TensorBoard.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \"run\" command of tfdbg's command-line interface now supports filtering\nof tensors by node name, op type and tensor dtype.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.string_to_number\u003c/code\u003e now supports int64 and float64 outputs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-30\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\"
