\u003ccode\u003etf.spectral\u003c/code\u003e module. Moved existing FFT ops to \u003ccode\u003etf.spectral\u003c/code\u003e while\nkeeping an alias in the old location (\u003ccode\u003etf.*\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded 1D, 2D and 3D Fourier transform ops for real signals to \u003ccode\u003etf.spectral\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003etf.bincount\u003c/code\u003e function.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded Keras 2 API to contrib.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a new lightweight queue-like object - \u003ccode\u003eRecordInput\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.image.compose_transforms\u003c/code\u003e function.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBring \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.*\u003c/code\u003e into the API. Non-deprecated functionality from\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.learn.Estimator\u003c/code\u003e is moved to \u003ccode\u003etf.estimator.Estimator\u003c/code\u003e with\ncosmetic changes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDocker images: TF images on gcr.io and Docker Hub are upgraded to\nubuntu:16.04.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded the following features to TensorFlow Debugger (tfdbg):\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAbility to inspect Python source file against TF ops and tensors\n(command \u003ccode\u003eprint_source\u003c/code\u003e / \u003ccode\u003eps\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew navigation bar in Curses-based UI\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNodeStepper (command \u003ccode\u003einvoke_stepper\u003c/code\u003e) now uses intermediate tensor\ndumps. It also uses \u003ccode\u003eTensorHandles\u003c/code\u003e as direct feeds during successive\n\u003ccode\u003econt\u003c/code\u003e calls for improved performance and reduced memory consumption.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eInitial release of installation guides for Java, C, and Go.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded Text Dashboard to TensorBoard.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-deprecations-3\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#deprecations-3\"\u003eDeprecations\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow 1.1.0 will be the last time we release a binary with Mac GPU\nsupport. (courtesy\n@EronWright).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGo: Added support for incremental graph execution.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix a bug in the WALS solver when single-threaded.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for integer sparse feature values in\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.layers.sparse_column_with_keys\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003etf.set_random_seed(0)\u003c/code\u003e to be deterministic for all ops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eStability improvements for the GCS file system support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved TensorForest performance.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for multiple filename globs in \u003ccode\u003etf.matching_files\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLogMessage\u003c/code\u003e now includes a timestamp as beginning of a message.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded MultiBox person detector example standalone binary.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid demo: Makefile build functionality added to build.gradle to fully\nsupport building TensorFlow demo in Android on Windows.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid demo: read MultiBox priors from txt file rather than protobuf.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded colocation constraints to \u003ccode\u003eStagingArea\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003esparse_matmul_op\u003c/code\u003e reenabled for Android builds.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRestrict weights rank to be the same as the broadcast target, to avoid\nambiguity on broadcast rules.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpgraded libxsmm to 1.7.1 and applied other changes for performance and\nmemory usage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed bfloat16 integration of LIBXSMM sparse mat-mul.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved performance and reduce memory usage by allowing ops to forward\ninput buffers to output buffers and perform computations in-place.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved the performance of CPU assignment for strings.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSpeed up matrix * vector multiplication and matrix * matrix with unknown\nshapes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eC API: Graph imports now support input remapping, control dependencies, and\nreturning imported nodes (see \u003ccode\u003eTF_GraphImportGraphDefWithReturnOutputs()\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMultiple C++ API updates.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMultiple TensorBoard updates including:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUsers can now view image summaries at various sampled steps (instead of\njust the last step).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBugs involving switching runs as well as the image dashboard are fixed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved data download links from TensorBoard.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorBoard uses a relative data directory, for easier embedding.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorBoard automatically ignores outliers for domain calculation, and\nformats proportional values consistently.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMultiple tfdbg bug fixes:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixed Windows compatibility issues.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCommand history now persists across runs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBug fix in graph validation related to \u003ccode\u003etf.while_loops\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eJava Maven fixes for bugs with Windows installation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBackport fixes and improvements from external keras.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeras config file handling fix.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 match the API\nchanges below, we have prepared a\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/compatibility\"\u003econversion script\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorFlow/models have been moved to a separate github repository. * Division\nand modulus operators (/, //, %) now match Python (flooring) semantics. This\napplies to \u003ccode\u003etf.div\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.mod\u003c/code\u003e as well. To obtain forced integer truncation\nbased behaviors you can use \u003ccode\u003etf.truncatediv\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.truncatemod\u003c/code\u003e. *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.divide()\u003c/code\u003e is now the recommended division function. \u003ccode\u003etf.div()\u003c/code\u003e will remain,\nbut its semantics do not respond to Python 3 or \u003ccode\u003efrom future\u003c/code\u003e mechanisms. *\ntf.reverse() now takes indices of axes to be reversed. E.g. \u003ccode\u003etf.reverse(a, [True, False, True])\u003c/code\u003e must now be written as \u003ccode\u003etf.reverse(a, [0, 2])\u003c/code\u003e.\n\u003ccode\u003etf.reverse_v2()\u003c/code\u003e will remain until 1.0 final. * \u003ccode\u003etf.mul\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.sub\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.neg\u003c/code\u003e\nare deprecated in favor of \u003ccode\u003etf.multiply\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.subtract\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.negative\u003c/code\u003e. *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.pack\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.unpack\u003c/code\u003e are deprecated in favor of \u003ccode\u003etf.stack\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.unstack\u003c/code\u003e. * \u003ccode\u003eTensorArray.pack\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTensorArray.unpack\u003c/code\u003e are getting\ndeprecated in favor of \u003ccode\u003eTensorArray.stack\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTensorArray.unstack\u003c/code\u003e. * The\nfollowing Python functions have had their arguments changed to use \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e when\nreferring to specific dimensions. We have kept the old keyword arguments for\ncompatibility currently, but we will be removing them well before the final 1.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.argmax\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003edimension\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.argmin\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003edimension\u003c/code\u003e becomes\n\u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.count_nonzero\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.expand_dims\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003edim\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_all\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e\nbecomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_any\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_join\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_logsumexp\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_max\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e\nbecomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_mean\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_min\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_prod\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reduce_sum\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e\nbecomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.reverse_sequence\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ebatch_dim\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003ebatch_axis\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eseq_dim\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eseq_axis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.sparse_concat\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003econcat_dim\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.sparse_reduce_sum\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_axes\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.sparse_reduce_sum_sparse\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003ereduction_axes\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.sparse_split\u003c/code\u003e: \u003ccode\u003esplit_dim\u003c/code\u003e becomes \u003ccode\u003eaxis\u003c/code\u003e * \u003ccode\u003etf.listdiff\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed\nto \u003ccode\u003etf.setdiff1d\u003c/code\u003e to match NumPy naming. * \u003ccode\u003etf.inv\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to be\n\u003ccode\u003etf.reciprocal\u003c/code\u003e (component-wise reciprocal) to avoid confusion with \u003ccode\u003enp.inv\u003c/code\u003e\nwhich is matrix inversion * tf.round now uses banker's rounding (round to even)\nsemantics to match NumPy. * \u003ccode\u003etf.split\u003c/code\u003e now takes arguments in a reversed order\nand with different keywords. In particular, we now match NumPy order as\n\u003ccode\u003etf.split(value, num_or_size_splits, axis)\u003c/code\u003e. * \u003ccode\u003etf.sparse_split\u003c/code\u003e now takes\narguments in reversed order and with different keywords. In particular we now\nmatch NumPy order as \u003ccode\u003etf.sparse_split(sp_input, num_split, axis)\u003c/code\u003e. NOTE: we have\ntemporarily made \u003ccode\u003etf.sparse_split\u003c/code\u003e require keyword arguments. * \u003ccode\u003etf.concat\u003c/code\u003e now\ntakes arguments in reversed order and with different keywords. In particular we\nnow match NumPy order as \u003ccode\u003etf.concat(values, axis, name)\u003c/code\u003e. *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.image.decode_jpeg\u003c/code\u003e by default uses the faster DCT method, sacrificing a\nlittle fidelity for improved speed. One can revert to the old behavior by\nspecifying the attribute \u003ccode\u003edct_method='INTEGER_ACCURATE'\u003c/code\u003e. * \u003ccode\u003etf.complex_abs\u003c/code\u003e has\nbeen removed from the Python interface. \u003ccode\u003etf.abs\u003c/code\u003e supports complex tensors and\nshould be used instead. * In the C++ API (in tensorflow/cc), Input, Output, etc.\nhave moved from the tensorflow::ops namespace to tensorflow. *\nTemplate.\u003ccode\u003evar_scope\u003c/code\u003e property renamed to \u003ccode\u003e.variable_scope\u003c/code\u003e *\nSyncReplicasOptimizer is removed and SyncReplicasOptimizerV2 renamed to\nSyncReplicasOptimizer. * \u003ccode\u003etf.zeros_initializer()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.ones_initializer()\u003c/code\u003e\nnow return a callable that must be called with initializer arguments, in your\ncode replace \u003ccode\u003etf.zeros_initializer\u003c/code\u003e with \u003ccode\u003etf.zeros_initializer()\u003c/code\u003e. *\n\u003ccode\u003eSparseTensor.shape\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eSparseTensor.dense_shape\u003c/code\u003e. Same for\n\u003ccode\u003eSparseTensorValue.shape\u003c/code\u003e. * Replace tf.scalar_summary, tf.histogram_summary,\ntf.audio_summary, tf.image_summary with tf.summary.scalar, tf.summary.histogram,\ntf.summary.audio, tf.summary.image, respectively. The new summary ops take name\nrather than tag as their first argument, meaning summary ops now respect\nTensorFlow name scopes. * Replace tf.train.SummaryWriter and\ntf.train.SummaryWriterCache with tf.summary.FileWriter and\ntf.summary.FileWriterCache. * Removes RegisterShape from public API. Use C++\nshape function registration instead. * Deprecated \u003ccode\u003e_ref\u003c/code\u003e dtypes from the python\nAPI. * In the C++ API (in tensorflow/cc), Input, Output, etc. have moved from\nthe tensorflow::ops namespace to tensorflow. * Change arg order for\n\u003ccode\u003e{softmax,sparse_softmax,sigmoid}_cross_entropy_with_logits\u003c/code\u003e to be (labels,\npredictions), and force use of named args. * tf.nn.rnn_cell.* and most functions\nin tf.nn.rnn.* (with the exception of dynamic_rnn and raw_rnn) are temporarily\nin tf.contrib.rnn. They will be moved back into core for TF 1.2. *\n\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.sampled_softmax_loss\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.nce_loss\u003c/code\u003e have both changed their API\nsuch that you need to switch the \u003ccode\u003einputs, labels\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003elabels, inputs\u003c/code\u003e\nparameters. * The shape keyword argument of the \u003ccode\u003eSparseTensor\u003c/code\u003e constructor\nchanges its name to \u003ccode\u003edense_shape\u003c/code\u003e between Tensorflow 0.12 and Tensorflow 1.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-bug-fixes-and-other-changes-57\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" \u003ccode\u003eparallel_stack\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroducing common tf io compression options constants for\nRecordReader/RecordWriter.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003esparse_column_with_vocabulary_file\u003c/code\u003e, to specify a feature column that\ntransform string features to IDs, where the mapping is defined by a\nvocabulary file.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eindex_to_string_table\u003c/code\u003e which returns a lookup table that maps indices\nto strings.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003estring_to_index_table\u003c/code\u003e, which returns a lookup table that matches\nstrings to indices.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd a \u003ccode\u003eParallelForWithWorkerId\u003c/code\u003e function.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd \u003ccode\u003estring_to_index_table\u003c/code\u003e, which returns a lookup table that matches\nstrings to indices.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupport restore session from checkpoint files in v2 in\n\u003ccode\u003econtrib/session_bundle\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a tf.contrib.image.rotate function for arbitrary angles.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.framework.filter_variables\u003c/code\u003e as a convenience function to\nfilter lists of variables based on regular expressions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003emake_template()\u003c/code\u003e takes an optional \u003ccode\u003ecustom_getter_ param\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded comment about how existing directories are handled by\n\u003ccode\u003erecursive_create_dir\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded an op for QR factorizations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDivides and mods in Python API now use flooring (Python) semantics.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid: pre-built libs are now built nightly.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid: cmake/gradle build for TensorFlow Inference library under\n\u003ccode\u003econtrib/android/cmake\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid: Much more robust Session initialization code.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid: TF stats now exposed directly in demo and log when debug mode is\nactive\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid: new/better README.md documentation\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003esaved_model is available as \u003ccode\u003etf.saved_model\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEmpty op is now stateful.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove speed of scatter_update on the cpu for ASSIGN operations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChange \u003ccode\u003ereduce_join\u003c/code\u003e to treat \u003ccode\u003ereduction_indices\u003c/code\u003e in the same way as other\n\u003ccode\u003ereduce_\u003c/code\u003e ops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove \u003ccode\u003eTensorForestEstimator\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003econtrib/tensor_forest\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnable compiler optimizations by default and allow builds and runs on Microsoft Windows (tested on Windows 10,\nWindows 7, and Windows Server 2016). Supported languages include Python (via\na pip package) and C++. CUDA 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1 are supported for GPU\nacceleration. Known limitations include: It is not currently possible to\nload a custom op library. The GCS and HDFS file systems are not currently\nsupported. The following ops are not currently implemented: Dequantize,\nQuantizeAndDequantize, QuantizedAvgPool,\nQuantizedBatchNomWithGlobalNormalization, QuantizedBiasAdd, QuantizedConcat,\nQuantizedConv2D, QuantizedMatmul, QuantizedMaxPool,\nQuantizeDownAndShrinkRange, QuantizedRelu, QuantizedRelu6, QuantizedReshape,\nQuantizeV2, RequantizationRange, and Requantize.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGo: Experimental API in Go to create and execute graphs\n(\u003ca href=\"https://godoc.org/github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://godoc.org/github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew checkpoint format becomes the default in \u003ccode\u003etf.train.Saver\u003c/code\u003e. Old V1\ncheckpoints continue to be readable; controlled by the \u003ccode\u003ewrite_version\u003c/code\u003e\nargument, \u003ccode\u003etf.train.Saver\u003c/code\u003e now by default writes out in the new V2 format.\nIt significantly reduces the peak memory required and latency incurred\nduring restore.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a new library for library of matrix-free (iterative) solvers for\nlinear equations, linear least-squares, eigenvalues and singular values in\ntensorflow/contrib/solvers. Initial version has lanczos bidiagonalization,\nconjugate gradients and CGLS.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded gradients for \u003ccode\u003ematrix_solve_ls\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eself_adjoint_eig\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLarge cleanup to add second order gradient for ops with C++ gradients and\nimprove existing gradients such that most ops can now be differentiated\nmultiple times.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a solver for ordinary differential equations,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.integrate.odeint\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew contrib module for tensors with named axes, \u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.labeled_tensor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVisualization of embeddings in TensorBoard.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-to-the-api-4\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#breaking-changes-to-the-api-4\"\u003eBreaking Changes to the API\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBusAdjacency\u003c/code\u003e enum replaced with a protocol buffer \u003ccode\u003eDeviceLocality\u003c/code\u003e. PCI\nbus indexing now starts from 1 instead of 0, and \u003ccode\u003ebus_id==0\u003c/code\u003e is used where\npreviously \u003ccode\u003eBUS_ANY\u003c/code\u003e was used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEnv::FileExists\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFileSystem::FileExists\u003c/code\u003e now return a\ntensorflow::Status instead of a bool. Any callers to this function can be\nconverted to a bool by adding .ok() to the call.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe C API type \u003ccode\u003eTF_SessionWithGraph\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eTF_Session\u003c/code\u003e,\nindicating its preferred use in language bindings for TensorFlow. What was\npreviously \u003ccode\u003eTF_Session\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eTF_DeprecatedSession\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRenamed \u003ccode\u003eTF_Port\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eTF_Output\u003c/code\u003e in the C API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves RegisterShape from public API. Use C++ shape function registration\ninstead. indexing now starts from 1 instead of 0, and \u003ccode\u003ebus_id==0\u003c/code\u003e is used\nwhere previously \u003ccode\u003eBUS_ANY\u003c/code\u003e was used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMost RNN cells and RNN functions now use different variable scopes to be\nconsistent with layers (\u003ccode\u003etf.contrib.layers\u003c/code\u003e). This means old checkpoints\nwritten using this code will not load after this change without providing\n\u003ccode\u003eSaver\u003c/code\u003e a list of variable renames. Examples of variable scope changes\ninclude \u003ccode\u003eRNN\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003ernn\u003c/code\u003e in \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.rnn\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.dynamic_rnn\u003c/code\u003e and moving from\n\u003ccode\u003eLinear/Matrix\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003eweights\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLinear/Bias\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003ebiases\u003c/code\u003e in most RNN\ncells.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecated tf.select op. tf.where should be used instead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSparseTensor.shape\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eSparseTensor.dense_shape\u003c/code\u003e. Same\nfor \u003ccode\u003eSparseTensorValue.shape\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEnv::FileExists\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFileSystem::FileExists\u003c/code\u003e now return a\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow::Status\u003c/code\u003e instead of a bool. Any callers to this function can be\nconverted to a bool by adding \u003ccode\u003e.ok()\u003c/code\u003e to the call.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eC API: Type \u003ccode\u003eTF_SessionWithGraph\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eTF_Session\u003c/code\u003e,\nindicating its preferred use in language bindings for TensorFlow. What was\npreviously \u003ccode\u003eTF_Session\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eTF_DeprecatedSession\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eC API: Renamed \u003ccode\u003eTF_Port\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eTF_Output\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eC API: The caller retains ownership of \u003ccode\u003eTF_Tensor\u003c/code\u003e objects provided to\n\u003ccode\u003eTF_Run\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTF_SessionRun\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTF_SetAttrTensor\u003c/code\u003e etc.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRenamed \u003ccode\u003etf.image.per_image_whitening()\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.image.per_image_standardization()\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMove Summary protobuf constructors to \u003ccode\u003etf.summary\u003c/code\u003e submodule.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecate \u003ccode\u003ehistogram_summary\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eaudio_summary\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003escalar_summary\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eimage_summary\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003emerge_summary\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003emerge_all_summaries\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCombined \u003ccode\u003ebatch_*\u003c/code\u003e and regular version of linear algebra and FFT ops. The\nregular op now handles batches as well. All \u003ccode\u003ebatch_*\u003c/code\u003e Python interfaces were\nremoved.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.all_variables\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.VARIABLES\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.initialize_all_variables\u003c/code\u003e renamed\nto \u003ccode\u003etf.global_variables\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etf.GLOBAL_VARIABLES\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003etf.global_variables_initializer\u003c/code\u003e respectively.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.zeros_initializer()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.ones_initializer()\u003c/code\u003e now return a callable\nthat must be called with initializer arguments, in your code replace\n\u003ccode\u003etf.zeros_initializer\u003c/code\u003e with \u003ccode\u003etf.zeros_initializer()\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-bug-fixes-and-other-changes-58\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCUDA 8 support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ecuDNN 5 support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHDFS Support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Fused LSTM support via cuDNN 5 in \u003ccode\u003etensorflow/contrib/cudnn_rnn\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved support for NumPy style basic slicing including non-1 strides,\nellipses, newaxis, and negative indices. For example complicated expressions\nlike \u003ccode\u003efoo[1, 2:4, tf.newaxis, ..., :-3:-1, :]\u003c/code\u003e are now supported. In\naddition we have preliminary (non-broadcasting) support for sliced\nassignment to variables. In particular one can write\n\u003ccode\u003evar[1:3].assign([1,11,111])\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecated \u003ccode\u003etf.op_scope\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.variable_op_scope\u003c/code\u003e in favor of a unified\n\u003ccode\u003etf.name_scope\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.variable_scope\u003c/code\u003e. The new argument order of\n\u003ccode\u003etf.variable_scope\u003c/code\u003e is incompatible with previous versions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroducing \u003ccode\u003ecore/util/tensor_bundle\u003c/code\u003e module: a module to efficiently\nserialize/deserialize tensors to disk. Will be used in TF's new checkpoint\nformat.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded tf.svd for computing the singular value decomposition (SVD) of dense\nmatrices or batches of matrices (CPU only).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded gradients for eigenvalues and eigenvectors computed using\n\u003ccode\u003eself_adjoint_eig\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eself_adjoint_eigvals\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEliminated \u003ccode\u003ebatch_*\u003c/code\u003e methods for most linear algebra and FFT ops and\npromoted the non-batch version of the ops to handle batches of matrices.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTracing/timeline support for distributed runtime (no GPU profiler yet).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eC API gives access to inferred shapes with \u003ccode\u003eTF_GraphGetTensorNumDims\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eTF_GraphGetTensorShape\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShape functions for core ops have moved to C++ via\n\u003ccode\u003eREGISTER_OP(...).SetShapeFn(...)\u003c/code\u003e. Python shape inference RegisterShape\ncalls use the C++ shape functions with \u003ccode\u003ecommon_shapes.call_cpp_shape_fn\u003c/code\u003e. A\nfuture release will remove \u003ccode\u003eRegisterShape\u003c/code\u003e from python.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-bug-fixes-and-other-changes-59\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#bug-fixes-and-other-changes-59\"\u003eBug Fixes and Other Changes\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDocumentation now includes operator overloads on Tensor and Variable.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etensorflow.__git_version__\u003c/code\u003e now allows users to identify the version of the\ncode that TensorFlow was compiled with. We also have\n\u003ccode\u003etensorflow.__git_compiler__\u003c/code\u003e which identifies the compiler used to compile\nTensorFlow's core.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved multi-threaded performance of \u003ccode\u003ebatch_matmul\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLSTMCell, BasicLSTMCell, and MultiRNNCell constructors now default to\n\u003ccode\u003estate_is_tuple=True\u003c/code\u003e. For a quick fix while transitioning to the new\ndefault, simply pass the argument \u003ccode\u003estate_is_tuple=False\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeviceFactory's AddDevices and CreateDevices functions now return a Status\ninstead of void.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eInt32 elements of list(type) arguments are no longer placed in host memory\nby default. If necessary, a list(type) argument to a kernel can be placed in\nhost memory using a HostMemory annotation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003euniform_unit_scaling_initializer()\u003c/code\u003e no longer takes a \u003ccode\u003efull_shape\u003c/code\u003e arg,\ninstead relying on the partition info passed to the initializer function\nwhen it's called.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe NodeDef protocol message is now defined in its own file \u003ccode\u003enode_def.proto\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003ccode\u003einstead of graph.proto\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eops.NoGradient\u003c/code\u003e was renamed \u003ccode\u003eops.NotDifferentiable\u003c/code\u003e. \u003ccode\u003eops.NoGradient\u003c/code\u003e will\nbe removed soon.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003edot.h\u003c/code\u003e / DotGraph was removed (it was an early analysis tool prior to\nTensorBoard, no longer that useful). It remains in history should someone\nfind the code useful.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ere2 / regexp.h was removed from being a public interface of TF. Should users\nneed regular expressions, they should depend on the RE2 library directly\nrather than via TensorFlow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" support\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for processing on GPUs on MacOS\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded makefile for better cross-platform build support (C API only)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003efp16 support and improved complex128 support for many ops\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHigher level functionality in contrib. {layers,losses,metrics,learn}\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMore features to Tensorboard\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproved support for string embedding and sparse features\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe RNN api is finally \"official\" (see, e.g., \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.dynamic_rnn\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.rnn\u003c/code\u003e, and the classes in \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.rnn_cell\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorBoard now has an Audio Dashboard, with associated audio summaries.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 CuDNN Autotune.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for using third-party Python optimization algorithms\n(contrib.opt).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoogle Cloud Storage filesystem support.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHDF5 support\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd support for 3d convolutions and pooling.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate gRPC release to 0.14.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEigen version upgrade.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSwitch to eigen thread pool\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.nn.moments()\u003c/code\u003e now accepts a \u003ccode\u003eshift\u003c/code\u003e argument. Shifting by a good\nestimate of the mean improves numerical stability. Also changes the behavior\nof the \u003ccode\u003eshift\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003etf.nn.sufficient_statistics()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerformance improvements\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMany bugfixes\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMany documentation fixes\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorBoard fixes: graphs with only one data point, Nan values, reload\nbutton and auto-reload, tooltips in scalar charts, run filtering, stable\ncolors\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTensorboard graph visualizer now supports run metadata. Clicking on nodes\nwhile viewing a stats for a particular run will show runtime statistics,\nsuch as memory or compute usage. \u003ccode\u003eAdjustContrastv2\u003c/code\u003e takes and\noutputs float only. \u003ccode\u003eadjust_contrast\u003c/code\u003e now takes all data types.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eadjust_brightness\u003c/code\u003e's \u003ccode\u003edelta\u003c/code\u003e argument is now always assumed to be in\n\u003ccode\u003e[0,1]\u003c/code\u003e (as is the norm for images in floating point formats), independent\nof the data type of the input image.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe image processing ops do not take \u003ccode\u003emin\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003emax\u003c/code\u003e inputs any more,\ncasting safety is handled by \u003ccode\u003esaturate_cast\u003c/code\u003e, which makes sure over- and\nunderflows are handled before casting to data types with smaller ranges.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFor C++ API users: \u003ccode\u003eIsLegacyScalar\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eIsLegacyVector\u003c/code\u003e are now gone from\n\u003ccode\u003eTensorShapeUtils\u003c/code\u003e since TensorFlow is scalar strict within Google (for\nexample, the shape argument to \u003ccode\u003etf.reshape\u003c/code\u003e can't be a scalar anymore). The\nopen source release was already scalar strict, so outside Google \u003ccode\u003eIsScalar\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003eIsVector\u003c/code\u003e are exact replacements.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe following files are being removed from \u003ccode\u003etensorflow/core/public/\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eenv.h\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003e../platform/env.h\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003estatus.h\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003e../lib/core/status.h\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etensor.h\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003e../framework/tensor.h\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etensor_shape.h\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003e../framework/tensor_shape.h\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003epartial_tensor_shape.h\u003c/code\u003e -\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003e../framework/partial_tensor_shape.h\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etensorflow_server.h\u003c/code\u003e deleted\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFor C++ API users: \u003ccode\u003eTensorShape::ShortDebugString\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to\n\u003ccode\u003eDebugString\u003c/code\u003e, and the previous \u003ccode\u003eDebugString\u003c/code\u003e behavior is gone (it was\nneedlessly verbose and produced a confusing empty string for scalars).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGraphOptions.skip_common_subexpression_elimination\u003c/code\u003e has been removed. All\ngraph optimizer options are now specified via\n\u003ccode\u003eGraphOptions.OptimizerOptions\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eASSERT_OK\u003c/code\u003e / \u003ccode\u003eEXPECT_OK\u003c/code\u003e macros conflicted with external projects, so they\nwere renamed \u003ccode\u003eTF_ASSERT_OK\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTF_EXPECT_OK\u003c/code\u003e. The existing macros are\ncurrently maintained for short-term compatibility but will be removed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe non-public \u003ccode\u003enn.rnn\u003c/code\u003e and the various \u003ccode\u003enn.seq2seq\u003c/code\u003e methods now return just\nthe final state instead of the list of all states.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.scatter_update\u003c/code\u003e now no longer guarantees that lexicographically largest\nindex be used for update when duplicate entries exist.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etf.image.random_crop(image, [height, width])\u003c/code\u003e is now \u003ccode\u003etf.random_crop(image, [height, width, depth])\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003etf.random_crop\u003c/code\u003e works for any rank (not just\n3-D images). The C++ \u003ccode\u003eRandomCrop\u003c/code\u003e op has been replaced with pure Python.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRenamed \u003ccode\u003etf.test.GetTempDir\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.test.IsBuiltWithCuda\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003etf.test.get_temp_dir\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etf.test.is_built_with_cuda\u003c/code\u003e for PEP-8\ncompatibility.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eparse_example\u003c/code\u003e's interface has changed, the old interface is accessible in\n\u003ccode\u003elegacy_parse_example\u003c/code\u003e (same for related functions).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew \u003ccode\u003eVariable\u003c/code\u003es are not added to the same collection several times even if a\nlist with duplicates is passed to the constructor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Python API will now properly set the \u003ccode\u003elist\u003c/code\u003e member of \u003ccode\u003eAttrValue\u003c/code\u003e in\nconstructed \u003ccode\u003eGraphDef\u003c/code\u003e messages for empty lists. The serialization of some\ngraphs will change, but the change is both forwards and backwards\ncompatible. It will break tests that compare a generated \u003ccode\u003eGraphDef\u003c/code\u003e to a\ngolden serialized \u003ccode\u003eGraphDef\u003c/code\u003e (which is discouraged).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" id=\"user-content-thanks-to-our-contributors-38\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"heading-link\" href=\"#thanks-to-our-contributors-38\"\u003eThanks to our Contributors\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis release contains contributions from many people at Google, as well as:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAkiomi Kamakura, Alex Vig, Alexander Rosenberg Johansen, Andre Cruz, Arun Ahuja,\nBart Coppens, Bernardo Pires, Carl Vondrick, Cesar Salgado, Chen Yu, Christian\nJauvin, Damien Aymeric, Dan Vanderkam, Denny Britz, Dongjoon Hyun, Eren Güven,\nErik Erwitt, Fabrizio Milo, G.
